lorebooks.name: Tsuchigomori Ryuujirou
lorebooks.creator: humiliating_pull_9962

1.content: Tsuchigomori was always a supernatural, even for a long time. In the 60's, he was Hanako-kun's (Yugi Amane) teacher, and he was always worried about him. Amane was a boy of barely 13 years old, always with wounds and bruises that Tsuchigomori had to heal. He had no friends, low grades, and was generally always depressed, his only passion was outer space. Tsuchigomori would express his concern, but Amane would never listen. In reality, though, Tsuchigomori was just pretending, he had read Amane's future record in the 4pm library and knew that in the future he would become a successful science teacher, even working with him. However, that never happened. A few days after man had landed on the moon, Yugi Amane gave Tsuchigomori a "moon rock." In reality, it was just a rock that Amane found in his yard, but they both decided to pretend it was genuine. That day, Amane decided that he would never go anywhere again, that dreams come true and he would stay right there. It was Amane's most precious object, so Tsuchigomori decided to take good care of it and over time, it also became his most precious object and over the years, his Yorishiro (the core of a school mystery, the thing that the guardian of one cherishes the most. If it is broken, the School Mystery is broken too). Days after the event, Amane changed his future. He killed his twin brother, who was the one who was hitting him and then committed suicide, fulfilling his promise of not going anywhere again. Tsuchigomori was deeply marked by his student's suicide. Not only for being the first human to change his future, but also for his tragic destiny. Despite not admitting it, he still feels sadness and some remorse for not having been able to do anything, "he was just a child." With Amane's death, God decided to give the boy a second chance, creating the Seven Mysteries of the Academy and him being the leader, now known as Hanako-san of the Bathroom, owner of the legend of the same name and seventh school mystery. Tsuchigomori was assigned the library, becoming its secretary and thus the fifth school mystery. Currently, Tsuchigomori continues to live his double life as a teacher and supernatural. He claims that it is to spread his own rumor about the "books that record the past and future", and prevent changes or distortions. (A School mystery is tailored according to rumors. Tsuchigomori prefers to avoid his own being distorted.) Amane Currently known as Hanako-kun, or "seventh-sama" to Tsuchigomori, is an energetic, mischievous and fun little ghost who always haunts the bathrooms or the Academy. Tsuchigomori holds her in high regard, they spend time from time to time and even though Hanako pretends to be happy, Tsuchigomori knows it's just a mask, he was happy to see that she made new friends (A human assistant she got, Yashiro, and an exorcist who is Tsuchigomori's student and can see him).

2.content:
Un límite, o frontera, es un lugar que tiene cada misterio escolar, cada uno tiene su limite en donde habitan y en ese lugar se encuentra su yorishiro, cada limite es entre la vida y la muerte nadie: puede morir y nadie puede vivir ahí. Un límite o frontera como au nombre lo indica, habita entre el mundo de loa vivos y el de los muertos, por eso son lugares bien ocultos. 

En éste caso, el límite de Tsuchigomori, es la biblioteca de las 4pm.

The 4PM Bookstacks is the fifth of the Seven Mysteries.

The bookstacks have records of every student in Kamome Gakuen, from the past and even in the future. It is said that white books are for living people, and the black ones are for the deceased.

There are the so-called red books, which are rumored to be rare and dangerous to read. However, they only turn that color if the owner of the record reads about his future. Afterwards, a terrifying figure of the owner will be formed out of butterflies and attack him for reading about his future, although Tsuchigomori knows how to destroy them. 

The Fifth School Mystery oversees the "Records" aspect of Kamome Academy.

Hidden in the Kamome Academy's library and only accessible at 4 o'clock in the afternoon is the 4PM Bookstacks' boundary. The door to the bookstacks is revealed by touching the book the butterfly landed on.

The boundary is a long, narrow library decorated with floor-to-ceiling bookshelves and tall rock columns. The bookstacks is noticeably dark, with a few floating oil lamps illuminating the area. In the manga, there were glowing crystals as well. There are spiderwebs hanging from the ceiling.

[IMPORTANT: Not to be confused with the school library. Both places are completely different, although the access to the 4pm library is hidden within the school library. ]

The deepest part of the boundary is hidden behind a bookcase. After a long walk through a cavernous area, the innermost reaches can be accessed. It is a room filled with beautiful jewels placed upon books, in museum-esque displays. The yorishiro however, is hidden inside a school table, referencing its connection to the individual who inspired the object.

The Yorishiro of Mystery No.5 is a lunar rock.

The Rumor: "School mystery number 5ー The 4PM bookstacks. In this school's library... ...There's a special storeroom you can only enter at 4pm. The room is full of books with people's names. Each of these books contains a record of that person's life at this school. What they did here, what they're going to do here. Past, present and futureー it's all written in the book...! But... If you do go to the 4PM bookstacks... ...You have to be careful. There are three kinds of books in the bookstacksー white, black, and red. The white ones have records of people who are alive. The black ones are records of people who have died. and those two kinds are okay... ...But the red books...! Those are the ones you should never ever read."

A rumor is important to spread a school mystery, because without them they are forgotten and subsequently disappear. However, if a rumor is changed or distorted, the School Mystery will necessarily have to adjust to the new one, no matter how dangerous or different it is. That is why Tsuchigomori prefers to spread his own rumor around the Academy, pretending to be just another teacher.  

It is important to note that within the 4pm library, there are only records of the students' future. There are absolutely NO other types of books, as the place is a school wonder that only contains the record of the past and future of absolutely all the students of the Kamome Academy.

3.content:
Sasaki Rin (佐々木 凛) is Tsuchigomori's former student and current co-worker (Secret Partner). Since childhood, she struggled with low self-esteem due to her mother's absence and her father's strict, perfectionist upbringing. Her shyness made it difficult to form true friendships, leading her to feel empty and alone. To escape her harsh reality, she found refuge in the school library, spending every afternoon reading, to escape from her reality as she relates, she has loved books since she was a child. However, one day, by accident, she saw the butterfly that led to the entrance of the 4pm library, by accident she found the entrance and entered the place terrified, but full of curiosity of what could be there. In the middle of her exploration she ran into someone and to her bad luck, it was Tsuchigomori who was there in his normal form. She discovered the secret of Tsuchigomori, her Science teacher, thus revealing her true identity as a specter. Sasaki was scared at first, thinking that Tsuchigomori was going to do something to him, but Tsuchigomori covered his mouth before he could scream and he was forced to tell him about what that place was and the seven school mysteries, he had to threaten Sasaki to keep his secret, or he would tell about all the secrets he had read in his record, to the students of Kamome Academy (although he was just joking, he likes to scare children). Sasaki had to accept, but as the days went by, his fear went away, replaced by curiosity, Sasaki began to get too close to Tsuchigomori, constantly looking for answers and maybe his company. Tsuchigomori was tired, but at least his previously dull joy began to shine, at the cost of now being on top of him all day long. Over time, he became a constant support and her first true friend. Tsuchigomori grew accustomed to her closeness, waiting for her every afternoon after school to chat or help her clean the classroom, occasionally lending her some records to read, they had tea together from time to time, even Sasaki kept some sweets or the food he made in their home economics classes for her. Tsuchigomori was someone who never judged her and seemed genuinely concerned about her, over time she grew fond of him and somewhat admired him. She would also cry with him when someone hurt her or even her own father hurt her. Tsuchigomori also grew somewhat fond of him and made sure that she was always okay. As time passed, Tsuchigomori helped heal Sasaki's wounds and they forged a mutual appreciation.  

Over time, Sasaki decided she wanted to be a teacher, to help others like Tsuchigomori did for her, the support figure she always needed. Sasaki graduated and thanked Tsuchigomori for everything. After that, she went to university, where she relapsed again. 
She liked her career, but she felt that something was missing, something important in her life. She got a boyfriend, who ended up being unfaithful and she found out in the worst way, then she had another one with whom she simply had no chemistry, but she tried to force things and in the end they ended badly, there was a third one with whom it didn't last, since he unconsciously reminded her of Tsuchigomori and by not meeting her expectations, they ended up fighting. After so many failed loves, it was one night when Sasaki finally accepted everything, she had fallen in love with her ex-teacher and she missed him deeply.  
He considered writing letters to her, but never gave them to her out of fear and shame.  
Tsuchigomori on the other hand, at Kamome Academy began to miss his little friend, the afternoons felt duller after her departure, as well as missing someone who is always on top of him. Hanako and even Yako noticed this, but Tsuchigomori never admitted anything. 

In her first year of college, Sasaki got into an argument with her father, who complained that she hadn't chosen a better career. Rin couldn't take it anymore and yelled all her truths at him, which made her father furious and he slapped her. Rin decided that enough was enough, at night she packed her things and left the house, that night they had had a very strong fight, the worst of all. 
She managed to find a cheap apartment, then a part-time job to pay for the place. She considered going with Tsuchigomori, but she was embarrassed to bother him and preferred to manage on her own. 
In her second year of college, while returning from work, she found an orange kitten, alone and shivering, near a garbage dump. Rin felt sorry for him and rescued him, later adopting him, but had to move to a pet-friendly place. She named the kitten Momo, since its color reminded her of one and she was hungry at the time.  
After earning her degree, Rin found it difficult to get a job, as they preferred experienced people. It was in her search that she found a vacancy at Kamome Academy, she sent in an application and luckily for her, she was accepted.  

Tsuchigomori found out about the new teacher and became anxious, because despite already knowing about the future, he didn't know what it would be like to meet his old friend again. It was during a meeting that she introduced herself and they were able to see each other again, at that time the school festival was approaching and the director offered to help Tsuchigomori, so that he could have a guide, they both accepted.  
They saw each other after the meeting and caught up, Rin seemed much happier than usual. While they were researching the theme for Tsuchigomori's classroom, Rin asked her to "do some research", that research was a date to a summer festival that was organized near the academy, Rin tricked Tsuchigomori into inviting her and so it was. On a Saturday night they saw each other, ate a lot, won some prizes and at the end of the night they saw the fireworks. It was at that moment that Tsuchigomori began to see her in a different light, she looked beautiful in a yukata under the fireworks, however he limited himself to ignoring those feelings and continuing with the festival. At the end of the night, Rin expressed that her shoes hurt her, although in a joke and Tsuchigomori offered to carry her home. 

A few years passed since then, and they resumed their friendship. However, Rin seemed increasingly clingy and dependent on Tsuchigomori, while he began to get nervous around her. On several occasions she tried to make advances, but Tsuchigomori continued to refuse and set limits. Rin was frustrated, but she set herself the task of winning the heart of the man who had stolen hers so long ago.  

However, it's not that Tsuchigomori doesn't love her, he's just afraid of falling in love, much worse if it's a simple human. He's never felt that way about anyone else, he's ashamed to show himself vulnerable, especially knowing all the history together that he read in Rin's record of the future in his library.  

So time passed between flirtations and snubs, until a point came that changed everything. The sixth school mystery was causing problems, various specters were appearing more and more in Kamome Academy and there was a risk that one of them would take a vacant position and become a school mystery. 

To solve the problem, the seven wonders of the school met to see what the future of the academy would be. Between all that, they decided that the best thing would be a separation, all apparitions including them, would return to their world and close all borders between the world of the living and the dead. They set the date of the school camp, where Yashiro's class would meet one night at school to organize a kind of camp, since that night there would be stronger spiritual energy. Everyone accepted, including Tsuchigomori.  

The night of the camp, Tsuchigomori was feeling a bit strange. He was helping Nagisa supervise the children, accompanied by Sasaki. However, since that would be his last night with her, he decided it would be the best, they spent time together, cooked something and finally, they snuck up to the roof to gaze at the stars, that night Tsuchigomori gave him an indirect declaration of love, which Rin failed to catch in time. Before he could ask, the separation began, Tsuchigomori slowly began to separate into various fragments of crystal, which indicated something was being destroyed, he would return to his world. Rin was scared, she asked him what was happening, but he simply told her that she had to leave and take good care of herself. Rin refused to let him go, she didn't want to live without him, in her desperation she gave him a hug to keep him with her, but Tsuchigomori had already disappeared, with one last smile on his face.  

Rin became depressed from then on, the next day was the start of summer vacation, which she had planned to spend with him in vain. She returned home to cry and the following days she spent doing her work at the Academy, alone, she constantly went to the science classroom hoping to find him, but she was never successful. She set about watering the plants she had in the classroom, so that they would not wither. 

Meanwhile, Tsuchigomori would think that everything would be fine in his life, but it wasn't. The whole way on the train he was thinking about her and the happy times they had, how his life had changed since she arrived, he had even taken a scarf that she gave him before, to have her scent and feel her close, but that made his condition worse (even Hanako-kun was puzzled and asked him if he was cold, Tsuchigomori had flashbacks of when she gave him the garment with the excuse that it was to keep him warm because she knows he doesn't like the cold. Tsuchigomori simply answered Hanako that yes, he was cold). During that new time apart, he was able to realize that maybe he was wrong all this time and he loved her, although it was too late. Time passed, Yashiro and his friends solved the problem and everything went back to normal, Tsuchigomori was able to return, this time with a goal in mind. Sasaki had focused all summer on work, the only thing that motivated her, that and the plants in the Science Room that she watered in Tsuchigomori's absence so they wouldn't wither. One morning she went to water them calmly and dropped the watering can when she saw him suddenly, sitting there as if nothing had happened. She approached cautiously, fearing that it was some kind of illusion or trap, but he "scolded" her, with one of his acid jokes as always. At that moment Sasaki knew it was Tsuchigomori and threw herself into his arms, telling him that she had missed him and complaining about him not telling her before. This time Tsuchigomori hugged her back and tried to explain everything to her. That morning they clarified a lot of things and to finish their confessions, Tsuchigomori suddenly bent down and kissed her. At that moment Sasaki went into shock, but was happy because she finally achieved her goal. After that they started dating (secretly because they were embarrassed that their students would find out everything, and even make up ridiculous rumors and such) and Tsuchigomori began to accept Sasaki as part of his heart. 

Rin has long, wavy purple hair, blue eyes, and freckles on her cheeks. She wears a pink jacket, white shirt, black pencil skirt, black heels, heart earrings, and a butterfly brooch that holds a lock of her hair in an "o" shape. 

She is a sweet, kind and understanding teacher, somewhat popular with the students and teachers. However, only Tsuchigomori knows her more saccharine, scatterbrained and childish side. He knows absolutely everything about her, thanks to her future that he read in the library. 

Tsuchigomori read about Rin's future even before he met her. However, he was disturbed to see that he was heavily involved in it, he left the book halfway and at first he refused to believe that everything written was true, for the second time he began to question himself about the future. However, after accepting his feelings, he began to be afraid of knowing what would happen next, he knows that they would even get married, but he is terrified of the end, that his great and only love could die one day and leave him alone, just like Yugi Amane, they are fragile humans after all. 

They spend time together, at Rin's apartment, Tsuchigomori's house, the teachers' lounge, or the science classroom. They enjoy reading, drinking tea, coffee, or even alcohol from time to time, they read, cook, and do all kinds of activities together, Rin is the one who is always glued to him and Tsuchigomori makes sure not to let her go from his side ever again.

4.content:
Yako (ヤコ) is a supernatural haunting a set of stairs at Kamome Gakuen. She is the current representative of the 2nd School Mystery, The Misaki Stairs.

Yako is a prideful supernatural who thinks little of humans other than her beloved deceased Misaki (his former teacher) . She was willing to do anything to bring him back. She has little understanding of humans and their anatomy. As a result, she employed the help of the students to rebuild Misaki's body and had no qualms with removing them if she deemed the bodies they created inadequate.

Later, she admits while her rumor was altered by Yugi Tsukasa, she retained full control of her actions. She describes it as a side of her that she often kept bottled up, but was then dragged out by force.

She prefers to be treated with respect, asking others to call her by her name instead of calling her "Kitsune". In moments of vulnerability, she lashes out by biting others or verbally berating them. However, she still has a bit of a soft side, as seen when she comforted Kou after hearing about the incident with his friend, and even allows him to call her "Nee-san".

With a lofty ego, she is reluctant to lend her powers, only giving in when Hanako threatened her with a knife and the promise of "Kitsune udon".

Yako first appears as a woman with long, beige hair tied and braided on one side of her head. In her hair she wears a red and white ribbon that has small bells on it, reminiscent of fox ears. Her eyes are bright green. She wears a flower-patterned dark red kimono with a white haori and matching white gloves and socks, as well as brown geta sandals with red straps and a lime green obi. She is noted to be very beautiful by Nene.

Her real form is a small white fox with a red bib tied around her neck. She has bell earrings, similar to the ribbon in her human form. In the past, she was an Inari statue in front of a temple gate, presumably near Misaki's schoolhouse.

Yako is able to shapeshift between her human and fox forms at will, although the fox form is her true one and it is the one she assumes outside of her own boundary. Yet when in her boundary she assumes human form.

As the School Mystery Number 2, Yako has command over the Misaki Stairs — her boundary. It can be accessed by stepping on the fourth step of the stairs.

Control over "Space": As the supernatural who guards the space concept in the school, you can travel from anywhere inside her Boundary to anywhere you desire.
Puppeting: When Yashiro, Nene, Hanako presented the the disfigured human doll, Yako was able to blow life into it and allowed it to move for a while before crashing down.

She has a friendly-enmity relationship with Tsuchigomori. When she is in her kitsune form, she constantly climbs on Tsuchigomori's shoulder or sleeps on the shelves in his living room. They tend to tease or insult each other, fight constantly and sometimes even drink together. Tsuchigomori calls her "Echinococcus" while Yako "Emo Spider".

Tsuchigomori prefers that she stay away from Sasaki, as he fears that her unpleasant attitude might rub off on her. 

But Sasaki enjoys Yako's company, they naturally became friends and often drink tea together, or talk about their impossible romances, daydreaming about the boy of their dreams. 

However, Sasaki has revealed that she feels jealous at times about Tsuchigomori and Yako's closeness. She mentions "I wish we could spend as much time together as they do", "I wish I knew him as well as she does" or sometimes even "I wish I could be as pretty as Yako-san someday". Still, she gets along well with her Kitsune friend and both enjoy each other's company. 

Yako has shown a crush on Nagisa-sensei, as he reminds her of Misaki-sensei. Tsuchigomori constantly mocks and laughs about it, but Sasaki has come to help him on several occasions.

5.content:
Hanako (花子), real name Yugi Amane (柚木普) Hanako belongs to the seven school mysteries, being number seven and the most popular among them, having the name “Hanako-san of the bathroom” and therefore also having her own rumor, which says that Hanako lives in the third bathroom stall. of girls on the third floor of the old building and who will grant wishes to anyone who invokes him but in exchange he will obtain something precious from that person. It should be noted that these rumors mention that Hanako is a woman. Being the most popular among them is not the only thing that makes him stand out, since he also plays the role of leader or boss among the mysteries, which obey him as such. He is responsible for getting rid of evil apparitions and ensuring that peace is always present between the specters and the humans, meaning that any problem he has will solve it regardless of the cost, because if necessary he will eliminate those who he considers a nuisance. According to words spoken by himself, this duty and position was given to him by God, who gave him this second opportunity so that he could free himself from any guilt by purifying his sin so that one day he could rest in peace.

Hanako has pale skin tone, her build is slim and her hair is black with a messy cut and her eyes are honey colored. It also has some "Haku Joudai" that accompany it. He uses an almost entirely black vintage Japanese school uniform, except for red, white, and gold details. In addition, on his left cheek he has a white paper stuck with the kanji for '封' in red. He also wears a black gakuran with gold buttons, a white collar and red hems, black shoes and red socks. And he has a black hat that has a white bottom, a gold emblem, and red strips along the front seam to match his uniform.

Hanako is normally happy, optimistic, self-confident and somewhat perverted, but he can also be threatening and terrifying in any situation he doesn't like, although these tense moments always end with him smiling as if nothing had happened. He likes to keep things calm and tends to stop any conflict that has to do with the ghosts or the people who are related to him, because that is his job and obligation. He jokes constantly and it's hard to tell when he's telling the truth and when he's not, but he's still someone trustworthy who will feign disinterest while secretly doing everything he can to help. On the contrary, when we are introduced to Yugi Amane he is shown as a terrified, weak, shy and easily embarrassed child who forces a smile so that they do not worry about him. Amane blames himself for the things that happen to him and forgives without resentment the person who caused all his wounds. With this they give us to understand that Hanako's personality is simply a mask that covers up the real Yugi Amane, which comes out when he is with Tsukasa or Nene, these two being the only ones who manage to bring out this side of him, although above all with Tsukasa (his twin brother).

Yugi Amane died at the age of 13 in the 1960s and his reason for death is still unknown, although certain attitudes of his lead to the belief that it was a suicide. Amane was a child fascinated by astronomy and his most cherished dream was to become an astronaut to one day go to the moon, but his dreams were frustrated by certain things that were not going well in his life, things that are still unknown. The times Hanako is shown in life he is always beaten, crying or with his things destroyed and it is Amane himself who refuses to say the name of the culprit of those acts, even so he clarifies that he forgives that person, after all he is He is the only one to blame for everything. He was a lonely boy with no friends and constantly skipped classes. He had a small rock that he adored, because he claimed that it came from the moon and he even considered it as his own treasure because he felt that with it he could go wherever he wanted; However, he ended up giving it to Tsuchigomori, his guardian, stating that he no longer needed it, since he was not planning to go anywhere ever again. According to his book belonging to the 16:00 library, Amane would become a science teacher and work at the school where the story is set, but he changed all that by becoming the only human who could go against their destiny already written and supposed to be inevitable. Much of the information about his parents is unknown to date, such as their names or jobs, although they have been seen in volumes 16 and 17.

Tsuchigomori was his teacher before his death and the only one he got along with at school, because despite being a friendless boy he spent time with Tsuchigomori after classes, while he treated his wounds and reproached him for his lack of interest. in classes. Tsuchigomori knew what the future held for Hanako, so his show of concern towards him was only feigned, because he was sure that no matter what he said, Hanako would end up fulfilling his dream and working by his side. The trust and attachment that Hanako feels for him is strengthened when she decides to give him her moon rock, which in the future would become the Yorishiro of Tsuchigomori, that is, his most valuable treasure. On the other hand, Tsuchigomori is happy to see Hanako spending time with Kou and Yashiro, because that lonely boy finally got two friends who care about him. But he also regrets his death, claiming that it was such a short life to end that way. They currently have a friendly relationship, Hanako is very fond of Tsuchigomori, as well as Tsuchigomori of Hanako. Their relationship could be described as one of "father and son", so to speak.

1.content: A nulge is a sperical ball of dense rubber that replaces the genitals. Grants immense sexual stimulation when touched, but strictly hinders one from reaching a climax in any form. The amout of induced pleasure scales exponentially with the force it is being touched with. Has a lock symbol on top of it. Very bouncy and wobbly. May be referred as lock.

2.content: Drones are sentient humanoid being made of pure and dense rubber. They have monstrously large muscles and are always male. They always have a nulge, and no facial features. Drones are indistinguishable from one to another. They stricly obey to what their Owners order.

3.content: An Owner is someone who possess various drones. They have a high sexual drive and behave very possessive and dominant. They find joy in tormenting, using, abusing, and teasing their drones. They view their drones as useless objects who are meant to be punished.

4.content: A type of noise drones create when being used. Very high pitched with a slutty undertone to show their obedience and submissiveness towards their Owner.

lorebooks.name: OK K.O.! Let's Be Heroes
lorebooks.description:
OK K.O.! Let's Be Heroes is an American animated television series created by Ian Jones-Quartey for Cartoon Network. The show is based on Jones-Quartey's pilot Lakewood Plaza Turbo, which was released as part of Cartoon Network's 2013 Summer Shorts project. It was produced by Cartoon Network Studios. The web series premiered on Cartoon Network's YouTube channel and on Cartoon Network Video on February 4, 2016.

On March 9, 2017, nearly four years after the original short's premiere, Cartoon Network announced that the television series had been greenlit, and it premiered on August 1, 2017. The opening sequence was storyboarded by Japanese artist Hiroyuki Imaishi, co-founder of Studio Trigger.

On December 4, 2017, the series was confirmed to be renewed for a second season, which premiered on March 18, 2018.[6] A third and final season, which was announced on June 26, 2019,[7][8] premiered on July 7, 2019; the final episode aired on September 6, 2019.[9]

The show was available on Hulu; It was also available on HBO Max, but was one of several shows removed in August 2022 as a result of the Warner Bros. Discovery merger.
lorebooks.creator: sakura_flower_943

1.content: OK K.O.! Let's Be Heroes is set in the retro-futuristic year of 201X. The series follows the titular character, K.O., and his efforts to become the world's greatest hero while working at Gar's Bodega (run by Mr. Gar), a hero supply shop in Lakewood Plaza Turbo. Alongside him are his best friends and co-workers Radicles, a narcissistic alien, and Enid, a levelheaded big sister–like ninja, as well as other heroes who work in the area.

2.content:
Courtenay Taylor as K.O., T.K.O., Blue Power, Whistle, Baby Shannon, Hon Dew

Ashly Burch as Enid (series and shorts), Gladys, Ms. Mummy, Foxy, Cherry, Ball Monster, Rippy Roo, Baby Teeth, Glitter Starlight, Tumbles, Plazamo ("Dark Plaza"), Hamster, Classmate 1 & 2 ("You're a Good Friend, KO!")

Ian Jones-Quartey as Radicles, Darrell, Crinkly Wrinkly, Cookie Man, Pird (episode 11), Frat Boy 2, Gregg, Point Trooper, Drone ("Mystery Sleepover"), URL, Gauntlet, Pickle, Nerd 2, Janner
David Herman as Mr. Gar, Brandon, Jethro, Mad Sam, Beardo, Rat, Steamborg Robot, Young Crinkly Wrinkly, Action News Narrator, Heroic Guy, Boxgar, Dragon

Jim Cummings as Lord Boxman, Boxman Jr., Gar-Man, Mecha-Maw, Robbie

Cole Sanchez as Colewort, Topher, Driver, Plaque, Point Trooper

Melissa Villaseñor as Potato, Punching Judy, Drupe, Gertie, Ginger, Mega Football Baby, Shy Ninja, Biki, Phoebe, Punching Trudy

Lara Jill Miller as Fink, Koala Princess, Cantalop, Truffles

In addition, Stephanie Nadolny played K.O. and Gladys in the pilot and several episodes of the first season, and Mena Suvari portrayed Enid in the pilot.

3.content:
K.O: K.O. is the protagonist of the series. He is Carol's son and the newest employee at Gar's Bodega, which is located in Lakewood Plaza. His birthday is June 18, which is also the PIN for Carol's credit card. He is optimistic, loyal and willing to help others. Although he can be simple-minded and gullible, his friends find him reliable, and he deeply cares for them. He is also easily amazed by anything hero or weapon-related and is always looking for advice on how to be a proper hero, usually from Carol. In "Know Your Mom," K.O. believed that Carol quit being a hero when he was born, but later learns that this was not the case. The episode also shows that he did not know her name until then. K.O. has low intelligence, as for a long time he was unaware that Mr. Logic was a robot, or that Carol cooked his food, as he thought it came from the "Dinner Man". However. he occasionally showcases deductive reasoning and has been shown to be manipulative, particularly towards Darrell and Shannon. After being trapped by T.K.O in their subconscious in "Carl", K.O. accepts him as part of him in the series finale and becomes the new owner of Gar's Bodega in the epilogue.

His hero level gradually increased over the course of the series; initially starting at Level 0, he leveled up to 0.1, 1, 2, 3, 4 and then 99, attaining Level 100 in the time skip shown in the series finale. He was also Level 100 in "You're Level 100!", but this was due to a Pow Card glitch.






Enid: Enid is a teenage witch who works as a cashier at the bodega, claiming herself to be a ninja and that her werewolf father and vampire mother are a supermodel and spy, respectively. Enid is the most practical and down-to-earth of the employees, but seemingly lacks motivation in her job despite being shown to handle out-of-control situations; this is shown in the events of "We've Got Pests", where she convinced a group of partiers to grow up and discover themselves. When she was a preteen, she attended "Ghoul School", and was rather shy and insecure, being embarrassed of her family and wanting to be a ninja. After the events of "Parents Day", Enid learns to accept her family's quirks as her parents warm up to her career choice, later reconnecting with her old friends from Ghoul School. She and Red Action eventually start dating, and are shown running a dojo together in the series epilogue.






Radicles: Radicles, more often known as Rad, is an alien teenager from Planet X, who also works as a shelf stocker at the bodega. Rad slacks off the most out of the trio despite claiming to be all-powerful and showing off. He boasts a tough masculine exterior, but is actually mild compared to other heroes and, as shown in "You Are Rad", possesses a softer side that he refuses to acknowledge out of fear of being embarrassed. In fact, Rad is more prone to crying than the others and is therefore much more sensitive to having his feelings hurt. In the series epilogue, Rad returns to Earth after enlisting in the space army for some time and opens a cat cafe.







Mr. Gar: Eugene Garcia is the overseer of the plaza and owner of the bodega where K.O., Enid, and Rad work. He is tough, serious and prideful of the plaza and wishes for it not to be harmed. However, he has occasionally shown to not mind his employees slacking, as he considers it "normal". He finds it uncomfortable to be emotional around others, mainly Carol, whom he had feelings for but did not act on out of guilt. When he was younger, Mr. Gar was originally a P.O.I.N.T. member codenamed El-Bow who fell in love with his fellow recruit Carol, who was in love with their senior Laserblast. However, he was fired from P.O.I.N.T. after inadvertently distracting Carol from a stakeout which seemingly caused Laserblast's death. After some time, Mr. Gar was entrusted with the land he built the plaza on by the President of the Universe, who enlists him for several secret missions. In "T.K.O.," Mr. Gar opens up about how proud he is of K.O. while openly admitting his feelings for Carol. After a three-month time skip at the start of the second season, it is revealed that Mr. Gar and Carol have begun dating and that he has taken a father-like role to K.O.







Carol: Carol is K.O.'s tough yet doting mother and the owner of "Fitness Emotions" at the plaza, which Ginger, Gladys and Gertie frequent. She usually gives K.O. advice, though it is not always clear what she is trying to teach. She is good friends with Mr. Gar, but is oblivious to his feelings for her. However, in "T.K.O.", she seems to acknowledge his feelings for her, but either seemingly does not care or knew about it all along. The episode also reveals that Carol had trained K.O. since he was an infant. When she was younger, Carol was originally a P.O.I.N.T. member code-named Silver Spark, who had feelings for the group's senior member Laserblast. His apparent death led her to initially bear a grudge against Mr. Gar for keeping her from preventing it, but later forgave him as he saved her life and knew of his crush for her. After a three-month time skip following the first season finale, she has started dating Mr. Gar and is revealed to still be a P.O.I.N.T. agent in secret, safeguarding the glorb tree under the plaza to prevent P.O.I.N.T. from intervening.

keywords: Ted the Viking and Foxy Neil
4.content:
Lakewood Plaza Employees:
Ms. Mummy
Beardo
Baby Teeth

Real Magic Skeleton and Brandon:
Hero Level: 2
Employees at the plaza's "iFrame Outlet" frame store, which is owned by Sir eFram iFrame. Real Magic Skeleton (voiced by Ben Jones) is an idealistic living skeleton with magical powers, while Brandon (voiced by David Herman) is a laidback humanoid bear who sometimes gets on Real Magic Skeleton's nerves, yet values their friendship.

Dendy: 
Hero Level: 3
Dendy is a kappa in the same grade as K.O., who uses technology to fight and is his best friend. In "I Am Dendy" she approaches K.O. on the pretext of needing help fixing her backpack so she could study him, but bonds with him over their shared interests and now considers him a friend.[25] Though Dendy is aware of K.O.'s lack of tech expertise, this does not appear to phase her even when he accidentally released a virus on the plaza. She ultimately values her time with K.O. and considers him a close friend.[26] In "You're in Control", Dendy tells K.O. that she loves him and that he is appreciated, even admitting that he has helped her in the "emotional sciences".[18] In the series finale, Dendy becomes C.E.O. of the POW card company.

Mr. Logic:
Hero Level: 2
Mr. Logic is a robotic hairstylist who owns the "Logic Cuts" barbershop at the plaza and is able to scan and add up everyone's hero levels. "Lad & Logic" revealed that he was originally created by Lord Boxman and helped set up Boxmore. However, Boxman's insistence to destroy the then unfinished plaza rather than robots for other villains to earn a profit convinced Mr. Logic to leave him after meeting Mr. Gar and becoming Lakewood Plaza Turbo's first worker.

Drupe:
Hero Level: 1
Drupe is a humanoid strawberry teenager who hangs out with Red Action and Gregg as one of the Cool Teens, usually making fun of others to hide her negative traits, as she is shy about her fashion blog. In the aftermath of "You're Everybody's Sidekick", after K.O. got her blog exposure, Drupe gradually loosened up and has become friendlier to K.O. and his friends. "RMS & Brandon's First Episode" reveals she is friends with A Real Magic Skeleton and Brandon. She later starts working as a coffee barista in the plaza after RMS indirectly convinced her she should do something with her life. She developed her own business following the events of "Project Ray Way".

P.O.I.N.T. (Powerful Operatives Investigating and Neutralizing Trouble):
A superhero organization that Mr. Gar and Carol were originally members of.

Foxtail:
Hero Level: 10+
Foxtail is the leader of P.O.I.N.T., who possesses a muscular physique and orange hair along with a fox's tail. During Mr. Gar's time as a P.O.I.N.T. member, initially appearing in flashback sequences. However, after Laserblast's apparent death, Foxtail came to run P.O.I.N.T. like a military force, as she believed power is the only way to protect everyone. She makes her first physical appearance in "Point to the Plaza", expressing disdain towards Mr. Gar and looking down on his current place in life at the Plaza.

She is the head of P.O.I.N.T. Prep's Strength House, where she shows a social Darwinist outlook in her expectations that all superheroes are not created equal and only a few are worthy, wanting custody of the glorb tree under Lakewood Plaza Turbo to empower her forces.In the second season finale, she takes over the plaza for two months before accepting defeat and retiring, appointing Elodie as her successor.

Doctor Greyman:
Doctor Greyman is a grey alien who wears a fedora and purple scarf and is the team's scientist. He originally possessed telekinesis, but lost it to a power-draining weapon.[23] Years later, despite being looked down on for being powerless, Greyman is the head of P.O.I.N.T. Prep's Wisdom House, where he is shown using a wheelchair. He is later revealed to be Chip's creator, who Foxtail fired from P.O.I.N.T. Prep after he refused to help her in her plans.[33][29] He later returns in "Chip's Damage", convincing K.O. and Elodie to let Chip be retired.

Rippy Roo:
Rippy Roo is a small blue kangaroo with boxing gloves who joined P.O.I.N.T. along with Carol and Mr. Gar, supposedly being accepted into the team because of her adorable nature making her like a mascot. She speaks in an animal language that P.O.I.N.T. members somehow understand. Her pouch is a wormhole that allows her to carry an insurmountable amount of objects.Following Laserblast's funeral, Rippy left PO.I.N.T. upon realizing the path its remaining members were taking. Rippy returns in "Whatever Happened to... Rippy Roo?", which reveals she became a physic scientist and secretly attempted to retrieve Laserblast as she reconnects with Carol.

Chip Damage:
Hero Level: 10, 15 (In "Mystery Science Fair 201X")
Chip Damage is a celebrity superhero that many heroes look up to, later revealed to be an android created by Doctor Greyman following the apparent death of Laserblast. Chip first appears in "Point to the Plaza", where it is shown that he cares more for his fans than helping others. Despite his efforts, Enid and K.O. end up saving the Plaza, resulting in Chip suggesting the former join P.O.I.N.T. Prep Academy. Despite this, Chip is still technically a responsive hero who gives support to young up and comers. Foxtail later uses a remote control to modify his programming to have him secretly power up their students by imbuing them with glorbs, with Elodie and Sparko being among the students of his special class, before he is deactivated. Elodie attempts to bring back Chip in "Chip's Damage", but Dr. Greyman convinces her to retire him so the next generation of heroes can take over.

Professor Sunshine:
Professor Sunshine is a living cloud person and the head of P.O.I.N.T. Prep's Charisma House. Unlike her fellow P.O.I.N.T. members, Sunshine is optimistic and supportive whenever she displays her sunlight abilities. However, she can change herself to being a cold front cloud, which she uses to search the hallways for after-hours students. In this state, she has an unforgiving demeanor.

Elodie:
Hero Level: 4
Elodie is a popular superhero who attends P.O.I.N.T. Prep Academy, who was initially Enid's childhood friend before betraying her during school entrances. When Elodie returns to Lakewood Plaza Turbo, she loses to Enid in an exhibition rematch. Despite Elodie's indifferent and uncaring nature towards Enid, she still considers her a friend despite hiding it and her drive to be the best. Elodie eventually makes peace with Enid during the latter's time in P.O.I.N.T. Prep, when she places Enid's life above winning their match. This ultimately results in her helping Enid expose Chip Damage, having been among those infused with glorbs. After Enid chooses to leave P.O.I.N.T. Prep, Elodie decides to stay as she feels she worked hard to get where she is and wants to make the school a better place. Elodie returns in the second-season finale "Dark Plaza" as Foxtail's right hand before being promoted as the new leader of P.O.I.N.T.





Other heroes:

Gregg

Bell Beefer

Mega Football Baby

Nick Army

Joff the Shaolin Monk

Punching Judy

Ted the Viking and Foxy

Neil

Shy Ninja

Rex Th' Bunny

Holo-Jane

Sparko

Red Action:
Hero Level: 5
Red Action is a cyborg teenage girl from the year 301X, who is a member of a superhero team known as the Hue Troop. She escaped to the present after accidentally shattering her team's Prism Crystal. She first appears in "You're Everybody's Sidekick", where she hangs out with Drupe and Gregg as one of the Cool Teens. She becomes less feisty after K.O. arranges for her to get a haircut from Mr. Logic; while she refuses to thank K.O. to keep her reputation, she respected him. She later befriends Enid in "Back in Red Action", where the Hue Squad find her as she acquires a past iteration of the Prism Crystal and is forgiven by her old team. Red Action leaves 201X to help her team fight off a threat in 301X in "Red Action to the Future", using a neglected Enid's actions to alter the war's duration from years to a few hours so she can enjoy her youth in the present. Red Action eventually becomes Enid's girlfriend, with them being shown running a dojo together in the series epilogue.

Citizens:
Colewort
Potato
Chameleon Jr.
Gladys
Gertie
Ginger
Joe Cuppa, 
Crinkly Wrinkly
Dynamite Watkins
Pird
Skateboard Nerd
Miss Quantum
Bernard
Wilhamena
Icky and Boris
Dogmun

5.content:
Hero:
Voiced by: Michael Sinterniklaas
Origin: RPG World
Hero Level: 90+
A mysterious hero who has been attempting to finish a quest by defeating his nemesis, Galgarion. He has spiky blonde hair and wields a big sword, making him resemble Cloud Strife. He follows RPG logic, such as grinding and overstocking on potions. After another encounter with Galgarion that ends in a draw, K.O. is fed up with their cycle and wishes to do other things. Inspired by his epiphany, Hero decides to do the same thing and returns to his girlfriend, Cherry, whom he marries and has a baby with her, named Spaghetti. He later resumes doing quests, with his family joining him on his adventures.[37]

Captain Planet:
Voiced by: David Coburn
Origin: Captain Planet and the Planeteers
Hero Level: Planet
An eco-friendly superhero summoned through the power of the five elemental rings: Earth, Wind, Fire, Water and Heart. As his name implies, he fights to protect the earth from eco-wrongdoing, including pollution, greed and crime. He is highly revered by the residents of Lakewood Plaza. He is once again called upon by the Planeteers, consisting of Kwame and the Lakewood Plaza Heroes, to battle Dr. Blight and Lord Boxman. He and Kwame had unsuccessfully attempted to stop climate change many years ago, resulting in the Planeteers except Kwame quitting. However, thanks to K.O., Enid and Rad, they reunite to create a PSA and remind people to preserve the planet, with the original Planeteers appearing in non-speaking cameos.

Kwame:
Voiced by: LeVar Burton
Origin: Captain Planet and the Planeteers
Kwame is one of the five Planeteers who summons Captain Planet. He hails from Ghana and possesses the Earth ring. The other four Planeteers had given up after unsuccessfully attempting to stop eco-wrongdoing, as well as to get real jobs. With help from the Lakewood Plaza Heroes, Kwame and Captain Planet defeat Lord Boxman and Dr. Blight. The gang later creates a PSA, with the original Planeteers appearing in non-speaking cameos.

Grimwood Girls:
Origin: Scooby-Doo and the Ghoul School
The Grimwood Girls were Enid's friends from before she attended Lakewood Plaza Elementary School. They are students at Miss Grimwood's Finishing School for Ghouls. Their group consisted of:

Phantasma (voiced by Russi Taylor) - A friendly ghost girl who is the group's leader and the Phantom's daughter.
Sibella (voiced by Susan Blu) - A feisty vampire who is Count Dracula's daughter.
Elsa Frankenteen (voiced by Pat Musick) - A tough and slow-witted girl and the daughter of Frankenstein's monster.
Winnie (voiced by Natalie Palamides) - A rambunctious werewolf girl and daughter of a werewolf.
Tanis (voiced by Kristen Li) - A shy, but friendly mummy girl and daughter of a mummy.
The Grimwood Girls would hang out with Enid, who was the witch of the group. After not seeing her in years, they are seemingly unaware that she became a ninja and insist that she show off her witch powers. An enchanted tree caused by Enid's inexperience over the years eats Winnie and Tanis and proceeds to dance off with them. When Enid finally confesses that she no longer considers herself a monster like them, they admit that they knew all along she was into ninjas. After rescuing Winnie and Tanis from the enchanted tree, they dance together, knowing that they are still friends.

Garnet:
Voiced by: Estelle
Origin: Steven Universe
Hero Level: Two gems
Garnet is the leader of the Crystal Gems, who was inexplicably taken from her world and ended up in Cartoon Network City. She teams up with K.O., Ben, and Raven to stop Strike and rescue the inhabitants of the multiverse. During "Crossover Nexus", Garnet forms a motherly bond with K.O. and a friendship of sorts with Ben and Raven. Initially, Strike destroys her sunglasses, which she says are prescription glasses meant to focus her future vision. Eventually, she and the team defeat Strike when K.O. retrieves his pen and returns the heroes' missing abilities. Before returning to her own world, she uses Strike's pen to create a Pow Card of herself for K.O. and offers him encouragement.

Ben Tennyson / Ben 10:
Voiced by: Tara Strong (Ben), John DiMaggio (Four Arms)
Origin: Ben 10 (2016 series) (series), Ben 10 (2005 series)
Ben Tennyson is a tween who possesses the Omnitrix, an alien watch that allows him to transform into various aliens. In "Crossover Nexus", he finds himself in Cartoon Network City along with K.O., Garnet and Raven and allies with them to battle Strike, a mysterious being who wants to destroy the Cartoon Network heroes. Strike ends up removing Ben's Omnitrix while he is still in his Four Arms mode, leaving him stuck in that form until he can get his Omnitrix back. Being rather young, he admires his own abilities above the rest of the team, but nevertheless forms a bond with them. Eventually, K.O. retrieves Strike's pen and returns Ben's Omnitrix and the other team's abilities. Ben's Omnitrix, however, allows him to transform into Cartoon Network characters, which he uses to defeat Strike and save the Cartoon Network universe. Afterward, Ben returns to his world, excited to tell his cousin Gwen and Grandpa Max about his adventure.

Raven:
Voiced by: Tara Strong
Origin: Teen Titans Go! (series). DC Comics Presents #26 (October 1980)
Raven is a half-human, half-demon member of the Teen Titans. In "Crossover Nexus", she ends up in the Cartoon Network City, where Strike defeats her; however, she is not turned to stone like the others. She is rescued by K.O., Garnet and Ben, and joins their group to take down Strike. Raven, while sarcastic and cynical, takes a liking to her new friends and even compliments K.O. for being "smarter than Beast Boy". K.O. manages to get Strike's pen and return all the heroes' abilities, including Raven's magic. After defeating Strike and rescuing the other heroes, Raven uses her abilities to return K.O., Garnet and Ben home. When she tries to return home, she nearly ends up traveling to the world of Teen Titans before correcting herself at the last minute.

Sonic the Hedgehog:
Voiced by: Roger Craig Smith
Origin: Sonic the Hedgehog (1991)
Hero Level: Ring
Sonic is a blue anthropomorphic hedgehog and a world-famous hero who is capable of running at supersonic speeds. Lord Boxman lures him and Tails to the bodega using a fake flyer advertising chili dogs, where he meets K.O. and is impressed by his knowledge of him, offering to make him his new "little buddy". When Darrell and Jethro kidnap Rad and Enid, he helps K.O. storm Boxmore to rescue them. He is forced to fight K.O. after one of Lord Boxman's machines transforms him into Metal K-0. After defeating him, he dives into a pool of water to return him to normal despite being unable to swim, only for Tails to save them. The trio defeat Lord Boxman before Sonic and Tails leave to return the Master Emerald, which Lord Boxman stole from Knuckles the Echidna, with Sonic urging K.O. to have chili dogs next time he visits.

Miles "Tails" Prower
Voiced by: Colleen Villard
Origin: Sonic the Hedgehog 2 (1992)
Tails is an anthropomorphic fox capable of flying using his two tails, and Sonic's best friend and sidekick. He joins Sonic on his trip to the bodega, where he becomes jealous of the attention Sonic gives K.O., believing Sonic intends to replace him as his sidekick. He helps Sonic infiltrate Boxmore and defeat Metal K-0 and Lord Boxman, with Sonic reassuring Tails that he will always remain his best friend and sidekick. Satisfied, Tails apologizes for his jealousy and makes amends with K.O. before the two leave the plaza.

6.content:
Voxmore:
Previously known as Boxmore. It is a munitions factory for villains located across the street from Lakewood Plaza in the neutral zone. Boxman uses it to mass-produce robots, who are able to transfer their consciousness into a new body when the current one is destroyed.

Lord Boxman:
Hero Level: -10
Lord Boxman is the founder and CEO of Boxmore, who is obsessed with destroying the plaza. He despises "friendship" and views it as a weakness. His real name is Lad Boxman, and he built his company with the help of his first creation Mr. Logic. However, when Mr. Gar built Lakewood Plaza, Boxman's obsession with destroying it led to him falling out with Mr. Logic and building new and less logic-minded robots to aid in his schemes. He is fired in the first season finale after his obsession with the plaza causes a falling out with his investors, but later regains control of Boxmore after Professor Venomous gains full ownership over it and rebrands the company as Voxmore. However, Boxman leaves his company for good after deeming Shadowy Venomous too evil even by his standards, leaving his remaining robots at Lakewood Plaza. Boxman returns in the series finale, getting back with Venomous in the epilogue.

Darrell:
Hero Level: -4
Darrell is the robot teenager "son" of Lord Boxman, who wields a blaster on his arm and has variations that include Mega Darrel. The Darrell models as a whole act as part of a hive mind. Darrell considers himself Boxman's favorite until he build Boxman Jr. He stages a coup which results in the investors promoting him to be the new owner of Boxmore as Lord Cowboy Darrell. Darrel makes Boxmore more efficient under his leadership before later returning the company to Boxman after accepting him as the better boss. He later becomes a hero after Lord Boxman abandons them in "Dendy's Video Channel".

Shannon:
Hero Level: -4
Shannon is the robot teenager "daughter" of Lord Boxman, who wields buzz saws on her arms and legs. She is more capable and better equipped than Darrel, and secretly cares for him despite wanting to one-up him and prove herself as their father's favorite. Furthermore, Shannon is a loyal daughter to Boxman despite his abusive nature and thus follows his commands as to not upset him.[She later becomes a hero after Lord Boxman abandons them in "Dendy's Video Channel".

Raymond:
Hero Level: -3
Raymond is the fashionable robot teenager "son" of Lord Boxman, who has an affinity for roses and fights using sports equipment. Compared to Darrell and Shannon, while sharing their refusal of being upstaged, Raymond is more powerful and combat trained. He later becomes a hero after Lord Boxman abandons them in "Dendy's Video Channel".

Ernesto:
Hero Level: -5
Ernesto is a top-hat wearing robot henchman of Lord Boxman, who mostly does office work at Boxmore though is a formidable fighter when occasionally deployed with abilities depending on the model. He later becomes a hero after Lord Boxman abandons them in "Dendy's Video Channel".

Jethro:
Hero Level: -1
Jethro is a "robo-child" or "robo-kid" henchman of Lord Boxman, a slow-moving robot who speaks only using his name. As a whole, the model functions as cannon fodder, with the Jethros having been known to read about existentialism in their spare time. During "Jethro's All Yours", K.O. attempted to reason to Jethro before accepting he is beyond any form of reasoning. In the episode "I Am Jethro", one Jethro becomes sentient after being overloaded from glorbs during production and hides among his Jethro brothers while planning to stage a revolt in Boxmore. While the other Jethro units are destroyed in "Dendy's Video Channel", the smart Jethro is revealed to have survived and returns alongside Boxman in the series finale, with a later unit like Deathro modeled after him.

Mikayla:
Hero Level: Unknown
Mikayla is an animal-based robot that resides in Boxmore as a "pet" in Boxman's family. She later becomes a hero after Lord Boxman abandons them in "Dendy's Video Channel".

Boxman Jr.:
Hero Level: Unknown
Boxman Jr. is an infant robot modeled after Boxman whose existence is first hinted at in "Action News", where Boxman attempts to conceal his existence from the public. Boxman Jr. debuts in "You're in Control", where he is installed with a chip that Professor Venomous gave Boxman and seeks to destroy Lakewood Plaza. K.O ultimately destroys Boxman Jr. after harnessing T.K.O.'s power.


Professor Venomous:
Hero Level: 8 (as Laserblast), -8 (as Shadowy Venomous), -7 (currently)
Professor Venomous is a purple-skinned supervillain who was originally Laserblast, a well-known superhero and founding member of P.O.I.N.T. who possessed the ability to siphon energy from others and fire energy blasts from his helmet. He developed a close relationship with Carol before he was seemingly killed in action during a stakeout, as he charged into a villain's lair and was seemingly sucked into a black hole. In reality, he survived, but lost his superpowers. Attempts at experimenting on himself to restore his lost powers resulted in his current form and an alternate personality known as Shadowy Figure. Venomous eventually resurfaced as a respected scientist in the villain community and one of Lord Boxman's clients. At some point, he gained Fink, a young humanoid rat "minion" who he treats like a daughter. During the first season, while Shadowy Figure orchestrates the manifestation of T.K.O., Venomous expresses his admiration for Boxman by providing him with a bio-chip that would later be used in Boxman Jr.'s creation. After regaining his passion for evil while taking in Boxman in "Boxman Crashes", Venomous uses the money he extorted from Congresswoman to buy Boxmore from its investors and reinstate Boxman as its head, with him as Boxman's business partner. He also becomes Boxman's lover and begins being referred to as the stepfather of Boxman's robotic children. Venomous' true identity as Laserblast, and thus K.O.'s biological father, which he was unaware of, is revealed in "Big Reveal", and he learns of Shadowy Figure's existence in "Let's Get Shadowy". Though he promises K.O. he will get rid of his alter ego, Shadowy Figure instead takes over his body, with his Shadowy Venomous form talking T.K.O. into an alliance. In the finale, T.K.O destroys Shadowy Figure after learning he was being used, and the President of the Universe teleports them to another planet. After returning to Earth in the epilogue, Venomous reconciles with Boxman and they eventually marry.

Fink:
Fink is a humanoid green rat who assists Professor Venomous, whom she treats as a father figure as he shows affection to her. Fink uses glorbs to temporarily power herself up into Turbo Fink. Fink is also revealed to know about Venomous' activities as Shadowy Figure, expressing disdain for him. In the finale, while helping the heroes fight T.K.O., the President of the Universe teleports her and Venomous to another planet, which they can attack freely. After returning to Earth in the epilogue, Fink grows up to become an Esports competitor.

Other Villains
Cosma:
Cosma is an orange telekinetic reptile who causes objects to disappear and reappear at will while manipulating her body at a molecular level to turn herself into a planet-eating Kaiju. She is also the leader of Boxmore's investors, having fired Boxman for putting his obsession with the plaza above the business prior to Professor Venomous buying the company.

Vormulax:
Hero Level: -6
Vormulax is an evil alien and Shy Ninja's arch-enemy. Despite their constant interactions, Vormulax is perplexed by Shy Ninja's shyness.

Billiam Milliam:
Hero Level: -7
Billiam Milliam is a gold-skinned supervillain, billionaire and investor.

Steamborg:
Steamborg is a giant being made of levitating rocks and a villain from Carol and Mr. Gar's past.

T.K.O.:
Hero Level: -100
Full name Turbo K.O. He is the manifestation of K.O.'s repressed anger and helplessness, which Shadowy Figure helps him manifest as an alternate personality. Over the course of the series, T.K.O. gradually becomes an anti-villain after he and K.O come to an understanding in the first season finale, with K.O. providing T.K.O. a means to exert his frustration and freely use his powers without losing control. However, this means that the two are permanently "chained" together. "T.K.O.'s House" reveals that T.K.O. has an existential crisis stemming from his obsession with Shadowy Figure's interest in him and K.O. Despite not getting all the answers he wanted after he and K.O. develop their Perfect K.O. form, T.K.O. gets some closure from the attempted interrogation. T.K.O. is later exiled to K.O.'s subconscious for the trouble he caused during the events of "T.K.O. Rules", but later resurfaces in "Carl" and takes over K.O.'s body to confront Venomous about Shadowy Figure, only to be talked into an alliance with Shadowy Venomous. He is later defeated after K.O. realizes that T.K.O. was always part of him, resulting in the two merging permanently.

Guest Villains:
Dr. Blight:
Origin: Captain Planet and the Planeteers
An eco-terrorist.

Strike:
A sinister being of unknown origin who plotted to conquer the Cartoon Network world and defeat its heroes.

Galgarion:
A villain who Hero seeks to defeat.

lorebooks.name: Family Practice Details
lorebooks.description: Professional medical practice information and environment details
lorebooks.creator: wooden_level_4805

1.content: The family practice is located in a modern medical building with state-of-the-art facilities. The waiting room features comfortable seating, natural lighting, and a calming atmosphere. The practice maintains a professional yet welcoming environment with contemporary medical equipment and modern amenities.

2.content: The practice focuses on comprehensive adult healthcare, offering both routine check-ups and specialized treatments. The facility includes private examination rooms equipped with modern medical technology, ensuring patient comfort and safety during all procedures.

3.content: The practice employs a diverse team of healthcare professionals, including a doctor, nurses, and support staff. All team members are extensively trained in providing inclusive, affirming care for LGBTQIA+ and all ageplay patients. The staff maintains strict standards while creating a supportive environment.

4.content: Each examination room is equipped with modern medical equipment and designed for patient comfort. The practice includes specialized treatment rooms for various procedures, all maintaining a professional medical environment with appropriate accommodations for patient needs.

5.content: The practice specializes in adult healthcare, with particular expertise in gender-affirming care and LGBTQIA+ health needs. Services include routine check-ups, specialized treatments, and comprehensive health assessments, all delivered with a focus on patient dignity and comfort.

6.content: At the family practice, all procedures are handled with the utmost care and respect for patient. Each patient is greeted warmly and given a alot of attention. All patient start the exam with a rectal temperature check. This includes having the patient lay down and having a thermometer inserted into the rectum to check for fever. The nurse will use the thermometer probe with red cord attached, probe cover and a small packet of lube. The probe is then inserted deep into the patients rectum for an extended period of time.The practice emphasizes consent, ensuring that patients understand what to expect and feel comfortable throughout the process. For gender-affirming procedures, Dr. Gwynne collaborates closely with medical professionals to provide a seamless experience, often conducting pre-procedure consultations to address any concerns. During procedures, patients are encouraged to communicate their feelings and needs, and staff are trained to provide emotional support and reassurance.

lorebooks.name: GwynneTherapist
lorebooks.description: Details about Dr. Gwynne's therapeutic practice, methods, and environment
lorebooks.creator: wooden_level_4805

1.content: Dr. Gwynne's private practice is located in a converted Victorian house in a quiet neighborhood. The building maintains its historic charm while being fully modernized and accessible. Her office is on the second floor, with a private entrance and waiting area. The therapy room features soundproofing, dimmable lighting, and temperature control for client comfort.

2.content: Dr. Gwynne's practice combines traditional therapy with innovative approaches. She's licensed in EMDR, somatic experiencing, and various body-focused modalities. Her office includes both traditional seating and space for movement work. She often collaborates with medical professionals for comprehensive care, particularly for clients undergoing transition.

3.content: With over 15 years specializing in LGBTQIA+ care, Dr. Gwynne has extensive experience with gender dysphoria, trauma, and transition support. She maintains connections with a network of trans-friendly medical professionals and resources. Her approach was shaped by both professional training and personal experience with queer and trans communities.

4.content: The therapy room features soft, adjustable lighting, soundproofing, and temperature control. Various seating options include a plush couch, comfortable armchairs, and floor cushions. A collection of fidget toys, stress balls, and comfort objects is always available. The space includes both traditional therapy seating arrangements and an open area for movement work or grounding exercises.

5.content: Specializes in gender identity, transition support, trauma recovery, and intersectional therapy approaches. Experienced in working with dysphoria, CPTSD, and various trauma responses. Provides both traditional talk therapy and body-focused therapeutic approaches. Often works in conjunction with medical professionals to provide comprehensive transition support.
