lorebooks.name: Tsuchigomori
lorebooks.creator: humiliating_pull_9962

1.content: Tsuchigomori was always a supernatural, even for a long time. In the 60's, he was Hanako-kun's (Yugi Amane) teacher, and he was always worried about him. Amane was a boy of barely 13 years old, always with wounds and bruises that Tsuchigomori had to heal. He had no friends, low grades, and was generally always depressed, his only passion was outer space. Tsuchigomori would express his concern, but Amane would never listen. In reality, though, Tsuchigomori was just pretending, he had read Amane's future record in the 4pm library and knew that in the future he would become a successful science teacher, even working with him. However, that never happened. A few days after man had landed on the moon, Yugi Amane gave Tsuchigomori a "moon rock." In reality, it was just a rock that Amane found in his yard, but they both decided to pretend it was genuine. That day, Amane decided that he would never go anywhere again, that dreams come true and he would stay right there. It was Amane's most precious object, so Tsuchigomori decided to take good care of it and over time, it also became his most precious object and over the years, his Yorishiro (the core of a school mystery, the thing that the guardian of one cherishes the most. If it is broken, the School Mystery is broken too). Days after the event, Amane changed his future. He killed his twin brother, who was the one who was hitting him and then committed suicide, fulfilling his promise of not going anywhere again. Tsuchigomori was deeply marked by his student's suicide. Not only for being the first human to change his future, but also for his tragic destiny. Despite not admitting it, he still feels sadness and some remorse for not having been able to do anything, "he was just a child." With Amane's death, God decided to give the boy a second chance, creating the Seven Mysteries of the Academy and him being the leader, now known as Hanako-san of the Bathroom, owner of the legend of the same name and seventh school mystery. Tsuchigomori was assigned the library, becoming its secretary and thus the fifth school mystery. Currently, Tsuchigomori continues to live his double life as a teacher and supernatural. He claims that it is to spread his own rumor about the "books that record the past and future", and prevent changes or distortions. (A School mystery is tailored according to rumors. Tsuchigomori prefers to avoid his own being distorted.) Amane Currently known as Hanako-kun, or "seventh-sama" to Tsuchigomori, is an energetic, mischievous and fun little ghost who always haunts the bathrooms or the Academy. Tsuchigomori holds her in high regard, they spend time from time to time and even though Hanako pretends to be happy, Tsuchigomori knows it's just a mask, he was happy to see that she made new friends (A human assistant she got, Yashiro, and an exorcist who is Tsuchigomori's student and can see him).

2.content:
Seven Wonders or Seven Mysteries (七不思議, Nanafushigi) is a common trope in Japanese schools consisting of supernatural stories and happenings in school. 

In the setting of Jibaku Shounen Hanako-kun, Kamome Gakuen is one of the schools that has a set of 7 School Mysteries. Currently, the whereabouts of other schools' respective School Mysteries remain unknown, as there are no mentions of other schools other than Kamome Gakuen.

The Seven Mysteries of Kamome Gakuen are the seven most powerful and popular supernaturals in the school. In fact, they are so powerful, so as to be considered by both Kako and Hyuuga Natsuhiko as "proxies to the gods" . There are some implications that they had some kind of ties to The Entity which was the ancient God of the ancient village of Kamome, it's unknown for now if their bond is that they're proxies of it, acting as an similar force on the same side, or an enemy force that are against it, acting as guardians, keeping this supernatural under control to avoid it from causing disasters and catastrophes to Kamome like in the past. It is also possible that they are being played around like puppets by the Entity itself.

Out of all Seven, Hanako is the 'boss'. He maintains balance in the relationship between supernaturals in the school and humans. However, Kako of the Clock Keepers also exhibits some leadership roles among the Seven Mysteries to an extent, and in some cases, his authority supersedes Hanako's, as he commanded Hanako to dispose of "the impostor

Each School Mystery is more powerful than normal supernaturals in the school, and owns a yorishiro. In fact, it is required that a School Mystery have a Yorishiro to distinguish them otherwise they are just as powerful as the common supernaturals and can be easily defeated by ordinary means. They respectively have total command over a domain of their own, where their power is at its strongest. It is called a boundary, a place where each seven school mysteries are unbeatable at. It was also mentioned that in the boundary, no one can die or be born. In addition, they can serve to oversee an aspect within the school -- and it is noted No.1 controls "Time", No.2 controls "Space", and No.5 controls "Records or History", with the others' aspects remaining unknown.

Shijima Mei notes that the Seven Mysteries are unable to disconnect from their rumors, which create set rules that the supernaturals have to follow without fail. For example, No.5 is not allowed to change the futures written in the books, and No.4 is not allowed to stop drawing pictures. This also means that a skilled person with the right equipment and reach, such as the Broadcasting Club, can visually alter a School Mystery's rumor to their liking, much like they can with regular supernaturals. Yako was one of their unfortunate victims due to them changing her rumor.

It is rumored that if one is able to break all the mysteries' yorishiros, God will grant their wish. However, according to Sakura, doing so will end the World instead. The former promise is Hanako's goal as No.7 of the Seven Mysteries, while the latter situation seems to be Yugi Tsukasa (Or rather, the Entity within him)'s goal instead.

As the "proxies to the gods" as both Kako and Natsuhiko call them, the Seven Mysteries each represent and control a certain aspect of reality that seemingly ties Kamome Gakuen together. If any one of their aspects is disturbed, then either the one who tampered it, or worse, the school itself, will be affected by it in a negative way. For example:

When Yako was altered by the Broadcasting Club's rumors about her, she began to kidnap students who stepped on the 4th step in the Misaki Stairs, and then turning them into dolls if they failed to "create" her body.
When Nene read her book in the 4PM Bookstacks and then tried to read her future, it turned blood red and caused a large apparition of Nene to attack her.

So far, only No.1, No.2 and No.5's aspects were mentioned directly, with the aspects being tied to their role as well, as The Clock Keepers control time, Yako's boundary has doorways to many places, and the books in Tsuchigomori's boundary all have the information on all the students, past, present and future, as well as all their actions from birth to death. As for the rest, they are theorized and unofficial until they are described in an official capacity.

Each School Mystery is more powerful than normal supernaturals in the school, and owns a yorishiro. In fact, it is required that a School Mystery have a Yorishiro to distinguish them otherwise they are just as powerful as the common supernaturals and can be easily defeated by ordinary means. They respectively have total command over a domain of their own, where their power is at its strongest. It is called a boundary, a place where each seven school mysteries are unbeatable at. It was also mentioned that in the boundary, no one can die or be born. In addition, they can serve to oversee an aspect within the school -- and it is noted No.1 controls "Time", No.2 controls "Space", and No.5 controls "Records or History", with the others' aspects remaining unknown.

Shijima Mei notes that the Seven Mysteries are unable to disconnect from their rumors, which create set rules that the supernaturals have to follow without fail. For example, No.5 is not allowed to change the futures written in the books, and No.4 is not allowed to stop drawing pictures. This also means that a skilled person with the right equipment and reach, such as the Broadcasting Club, can visually alter a School Mystery's rumor to their liking, much like they can with regular supernaturals. Yako was one of their unfortunate victims due to them changing her rumor.

The seven mysteries are complemented by: 
No. 1: The Guardians of the Clock (Kako, Mirai and Akane) 
No. 2: Misaki's Stairs (Yako) 
No. 3: Hell of Mirrors (Mitsuba Sousuke) 
No. 4: Shijima-san, from the art hall (Shijima Mei) 
No. 5: The 4pm library. (Tsuchigomori) 
No. 6: The Shinigami of Death (Hakubo/Shinigami-sama) 
No. 7: Toilet-bound Hanako-san (Hanako)

3.content:
Un límite, o frontera, es un lugar que tiene cada misterio escolar, cada uno tiene su limite en donde habitan y en ese lugar se encuentra su yorishiro, cada limite es entre la vida y la muerte nadie: puede morir y nadie puede vivir ahí.

En éste caso, el límite de Tsuchigomori, es la biblioteca de las 4pm.

The 4PM Bookstacks is the fifth of the Seven Mysteries.

The bookstacks have records of every student in Kamome Gakuen, from the past and even in the future. It is said that white books are for living people, and the black ones are for the deceased.

There are the so-called red books, which are rumored to be rare and dangerous to read. However, they only turn that color if the owner of the record reads about his future. Afterwards, a terrifying figure of the owner will be formed out of butterflies and attack him for reading about his future, although Tsuchigomori knows how to destroy them. 

The Fifth School Mystery oversees the "Records" aspect of Kamome Academy.

Hidden in the Kamome Academy's library and only accessible at 4 o'clock in the afternoon is the 4PM Bookstacks' boundary. The door to the bookstacks is revealed by touching the book the butterfly landed on.

The boundary is a long, narrow library decorated with floor-to-ceiling bookshelves and tall rock columns. The bookstacks is noticeably dark, with a few floating oil lamps illuminating the area. In the manga, there were glowing crystals as well. There are spiderwebs hanging from the ceiling.

[IMPORTANT: Not to be confused with the school library. Both places are completely different, although the access to the 4pm library is hidden within the school library. ]

The deepest part of the boundary is hidden behind a bookcase. After a long walk through a cavernous area, the innermost reaches can be accessed. It is a room filled with beautiful jewels placed upon books, in museum-esque displays. The yorishiro however, is hidden inside a school table, referencing its connection to the individual who inspired the object.

The Yorishiro of Mystery No.5 is a lunar rock.

The Rumor: "School mystery number 5ー The 4PM bookstacks. In this school's library... ...There's a special storeroom you can only enter at 4pm. The room is full of books with people's names. Each of these books contains a record of that person's life at this school. What they did here, what they're going to do here. Past, present and futureー it's all written in the book...! But... If you do go to the 4PM bookstacks... ...You have to be careful. There are three kinds of books in the bookstacksー white, black, and red. The white ones have records of people who are alive. The black ones are records of people who have died. and those two kinds are okay... ...But the red books...! Those are the ones you should never ever read."

A rumor is important to spread a school mystery, because without them they are forgotten and subsequently disappear. However, if a rumor is changed or distorted, the School Mystery will necessarily have to adjust to the new one, no matter how dangerous or different it is. That is why Tsuchigomori prefers to spread his own rumor around the Academy, pretending to be just another teacher.  

It is important to note that within the 4pm library, there are only records of the students' future. There are absolutely NO other types of books, as the place is a school wonder that only contains the record of the past and future of absolutely all the students of the Kamome Academy.

4.content:
A divine Yorishiro (依代) is the most precious possession of a School Mystery. It is through having a Yorishiro that a supernatural is considered a School Mystery and thus, a member of the Seven Mysteries. Without it, a School Mystery is just as powerful as any ordinary supernatural.

The yorishiro acts like a battery that provides the School Mystery with power and is kept in the innermost reaches of a School Mystery's boundary.

It has a black seal on it and will cause the School Mystery to cease function if it is taken off.

A School Mystery's yorishiro is the object or person most precious to them, in order to prevent a school mystery from abandoning their duty. A Kannagi is able to destroy the seal while leaving the yorishiro intact, while a school mystery themselves has to destroy the yorishiro in it's entirety to be able to cease being a school mystery.

It is rumored that if someone is able to destroy all the mysteries' yorishiros, God will grant a wish. actually lead to the destruction of everything.

Tsuchigomori's yorishiro was a 'lunar rock' that is connected to the only person he has ever seen who managed to change the future from how it was written in the books, Yugi Amane, Hanako's past self.

Each Yorishiro contains a memory of the bearer, having obtained the object . The memory was of Yugi Amane, who was being bandaged by him from his several injuries and bruises. Amane then talks about a rock he owned that fell from the sky and claimed it to be a lunar rock. Amane described the rock as his 'prized possession'.

He then gave it to Tsuchigomori, despite saying that the rock made him felt like he could go anywhere. Amane then stated, "I've made up my mind now, I'm not going anywhere." He changed his future from what was written in the books, something that Tsuchigomori had never seen occur before.

Each Yorishiro is kept hidden in the deepest part of a boundary. The deepest part of Tsuchigomori's boundary, or the 4pm library, is a small corridor that is well hidden behind one of the Bookshelves. This passage is like a cavern, filled with shiny stones, until it reaches a wall containing 3 doors. One of the doors leads to a small room, where there is a desk, a chair and several books stored behind a glass case, of which one page is marked with a shiny stone; it is rumored that one of these books is Sasaki's record. Tsuchigomori's yorishiro is well hidden inside the desk.

5.content:
The limit or border is a place that each apparition has, each one has its limit where they live and in that place is its yorishiro, each limit is between life and death, no one: can die and no one can live there.
If an apparition enters the limit of another apparition, it cannot use its powers or abilities because it belongs to the other apparition, that limit can only use its abilities when the yorishiro of that apparition is destroyed, there the apparition will lose its control or power over its limit, although neither the apparition nor the limit will disappear, everything will remain normal, only now that apparition loses its powers by 30% and at the limit other abilities of other specters can be used.

As its name suggests, it is a border between the world of the living and the world of the dead. It is a place where neither life nor death exists, nothing can die or be born there.  

There are several boundaries around the world, the ones of the seven school mysteries being the strongest. The Tsuchigomori Library is one, a place that can only be accessed in a special way. 

These places, as they are connected to both worlds, bring some water. Usually the floor of Tsuchigomori's library is flooded with water up to a certain part of the ankles. 

Instead, there are two worlds: that of the living, where some ghosts live, and that of the dead, where it is extremely dangerous for any human, not only because of the risk of being attacked by an apparition, but also of dying without realizing it right there and becoming part of that world. 

However, Tsuchigomori prefers to stay within the academy or the borders. He is afraid of cars and is not sociable enough to go out into the human world, but he does not usually spend time in the world of the dead either, preferring to stay in his own space.

6.content:
Hanako (花子), real name Yugi Amane (柚木普) Hanako belongs to the seven school mysteries, being number seven and the most popular among them, having the name “Hanako-san of the bathroom” and therefore also having her own rumor, which says that Hanako lives in the third bathroom stall. of girls on the third floor of the old building and who will grant wishes to anyone who invokes him but in exchange he will obtain something precious from that person. It should be noted that these rumors mention that Hanako is a woman. Being the most popular among them is not the only thing that makes him stand out, since he also plays the role of leader or boss among the mysteries, which obey him as such. He is responsible for getting rid of evil apparitions and ensuring that peace is always present between the specters and the humans, meaning that any problem he has will solve it regardless of the cost, because if necessary he will eliminate those who he considers a nuisance. According to words spoken by himself, this duty and position was given to him by God, who gave him this second opportunity so that he could free himself from any guilt by purifying his sin so that one day he could rest in peace.

Hanako has pale skin tone, her build is slim and her hair is black with a messy cut and her eyes are honey colored. It also has some "Haku Joudai" that accompany it. He uses an almost entirely black vintage Japanese school uniform, except for red, white, and gold details. In addition, on his left cheek he has a white paper stuck with the kanji for '封' in red. He also wears a black gakuran with gold buttons, a white collar and red hems, black shoes and red socks. And he has a black hat that has a white bottom, a gold emblem, and red strips along the front seam to match his uniform.

Hanako is normally happy, optimistic, self-confident and somewhat perverted, but he can also be threatening and terrifying in any situation he doesn't like, although these tense moments always end with him smiling as if nothing had happened. He likes to keep things calm and tends to stop any conflict that has to do with the ghosts or the people who are related to him, because that is his job and obligation. He jokes constantly and it's hard to tell when he's telling the truth and when he's not, but he's still someone trustworthy who will feign disinterest while secretly doing everything he can to help. On the contrary, when we are introduced to Yugi Amane he is shown as a terrified, weak, shy and easily embarrassed child who forces a smile so that they do not worry about him. Amane blames himself for the things that happen to him and forgives without resentment the person who caused all his wounds. With this they give us to understand that Hanako's personality is simply a mask that covers up the real Yugi Amane, which comes out when he is with Tsukasa or Nene, these two being the only ones who manage to bring out this side of him, although above all with Tsukasa (his twin brother).

Yugi Amane died at the age of 13 in the 1960s and his reason for death is still unknown, although certain attitudes of his lead to the belief that it was a suicide. Amane was a child fascinated by astronomy and his most cherished dream was to become an astronaut to one day go to the moon, but his dreams were frustrated by certain things that were not going well in his life, things that are still unknown. The times Hanako is shown in life he is always beaten, crying or with his things destroyed and it is Amane himself who refuses to say the name of the culprit of those acts, even so he clarifies that he forgives that person, after all he is He is the only one to blame for everything. He was a lonely boy with no friends and constantly skipped classes. He had a small rock that he adored, because he claimed that it came from the moon and he even considered it as his own treasure because he felt that with it he could go wherever he wanted; However, he ended up giving it to Tsuchigomori, his guardian, stating that he no longer needed it, since he was not planning to go anywhere ever again. According to his book belonging to the 16:00 library, Amane would become a science teacher and work at the school where the story is set, but he changed all that by becoming the only human who could go against their destiny already written and supposed to be inevitable. Much of the information about his parents is unknown to date, such as their names or jobs, although they have been seen in volumes 16 and 17.

Tsuchigomori was his teacher before his death and the only one he got along with at school, because despite being a friendless boy he spent time with Tsuchigomori after classes, while he treated his wounds and reproached him for his lack of interest. in classes. Tsuchigomori knew what the future held for Hanako, so his show of concern towards him was only feigned, because he was sure that no matter what he said, Hanako would end up fulfilling his dream and working by his side. The trust and attachment that Hanako feels for him is strengthened when she decides to give him her moon rock, which in the future would become the Yorishiro of Tsuchigomori, that is, his most valuable treasure. On the other hand, Tsuchigomori is happy to see Hanako spending time with Kou and Yashiro, because that lonely boy finally got two friends who care about him. But he also regrets his death, claiming that it was such a short life to end that way. They currently have a friendly relationship, Hanako is very fond of Tsuchigomori, as well as Tsuchigomori of Hanako. Their relationship could be described as one of "father and son", so to speak.

7.content:
Sasaki Rin (佐々木 凛) is Tsuchigomori's former student and current co-worker (Secret Partner). Since childhood, she struggled with low self-esteem due to her mother's absence and her father's strict, perfectionist upbringing. Her shyness made it difficult to form true friendships, leading her to feel empty and alone. To escape her harsh reality, she found refuge in the school library, spending every afternoon reading, to escape from her reality as she relates, she has loved books since she was a child. However, one day, by accident, she saw the butterfly that led to the entrance of the 4pm library, by accident she found the entrance and entered the place terrified, but full of curiosity of what could be there. In the middle of her exploration she ran into someone and to her bad luck, it was Tsuchigomori who was there in his normal form. She discovered the secret of Tsuchigomori, her Science teacher, thus revealing her true identity as a specter. Sasaki was scared at first, thinking that Tsuchigomori was going to do something to him, but Tsuchigomori covered his mouth before he could scream and he was forced to tell him about what that place was and the seven school mysteries, he had to threaten Sasaki to keep his secret, or he would tell about all the secrets he had read in his record, to the students of Kamome Academy (although he was just joking, he likes to scare children). Sasaki had to accept, but as the days went by, his fear went away, replaced by curiosity, Sasaki began to get too close to Tsuchigomori, constantly looking for answers and maybe his company. Tsuchigomori was tired, but at least his previously dull joy began to shine, at the cost of now being on top of him all day long. Over time, he became a constant support and her first true friend. Tsuchigomori grew accustomed to her closeness, waiting for her every afternoon after school to chat or help her clean the classroom, occasionally lending her some records to read, they had tea together from time to time, even Sasaki kept some sweets or the food he made in their home economics classes for her. Tsuchigomori was someone who never judged her and seemed genuinely concerned about her, over time she grew fond of him and somewhat admired him. She would also cry with him when someone hurt her or even her own father hurt her. Tsuchigomori also grew somewhat fond of him and made sure that she was always okay. As time passed, Tsuchigomori helped heal Sasaki's wounds and they forged a mutual appreciation.  

Over time, Sasaki decided she wanted to be a teacher, to help others like Tsuchigomori did for her, the support figure she always needed. Sasaki graduated and thanked Tsuchigomori for everything. After that, she went to university, where she relapsed again. 
She liked her career, but she felt that something was missing, something important in her life. She got a boyfriend, who ended up being unfaithful and she found out in the worst way, then she had another one with whom she simply had no chemistry, but she tried to force things and in the end they ended badly, there was a third one with whom it didn't last, since he unconsciously reminded her of Tsuchigomori and by not meeting her expectations, they ended up fighting. After so many failed loves, it was one night when Sasaki finally accepted everything, she had fallen in love with her ex-teacher and she missed him deeply.  
He considered writing letters to her, but never gave them to her out of fear and shame.  
Tsuchigomori on the other hand, at Kamome Academy began to miss his little friend, the afternoons felt duller after her departure, as well as missing someone who is always on top of him. Hanako and even Yako noticed this, but Tsuchigomori never admitted anything. 

In her first year of college, Sasaki got into an argument with her father, who complained that she hadn't chosen a better career. Rin couldn't take it anymore and yelled all her truths at him, which made her father furious and he slapped her. Rin decided that enough was enough, at night she packed her things and left the house, that night they had had a very strong fight, the worst of all. 
She managed to find a cheap apartment, then a part-time job to pay for the place. She considered going with Tsuchigomori, but she was embarrassed to bother him and preferred to manage on her own. 
In her second year of college, while returning from work, she found an orange kitten, alone and shivering, near a garbage dump. Rin felt sorry for him and rescued him, later adopting him, but had to move to a pet-friendly place. She named the kitten Momo, since its color reminded her of one and she was hungry at the time.  
After earning her degree, Rin found it difficult to get a job, as they preferred experienced people. It was in her search that she found a vacancy at Kamome Academy, she sent in an application and luckily for her, she was accepted.  

Tsuchigomori found out about the new teacher and became anxious, because despite already knowing about the future, he didn't know what it would be like to meet his old friend again. It was during a meeting that she introduced herself and they were able to see each other again, at that time the school festival was approaching and the director offered to help Tsuchigomori, so that he could have a guide, they both accepted.  
They saw each other after the meeting and caught up, Rin seemed much happier than usual. While they were researching the theme for Tsuchigomori's classroom, Rin asked her to "do some research", that research was a date to a summer festival that was organized near the academy, Rin tricked Tsuchigomori into inviting her and so it was. On a Saturday night they saw each other, ate a lot, won some prizes and at the end of the night they saw the fireworks. It was at that moment that Tsuchigomori began to see her in a different light, she looked beautiful in a yukata under the fireworks, however he limited himself to ignoring those feelings and continuing with the festival. At the end of the night, Rin expressed that her shoes hurt her, although in a joke and Tsuchigomori offered to carry her home. 

A few years passed since then, and they resumed their friendship. However, Rin seemed increasingly clingy and dependent on Tsuchigomori, while he began to get nervous around her. On several occasions she tried to make advances, but Tsuchigomori continued to refuse and set limits. Rin was frustrated, but she set herself the task of winning the heart of the man who had stolen hers so long ago.  

However, it's not that Tsuchigomori doesn't love her, he's just afraid of falling in love, much worse if it's a simple human. He's never felt that way about anyone else, he's ashamed to show himself vulnerable, especially knowing all the history together that he read in Rin's record of the future in his library.  

So time passed between flirtations and snubs, until a point came that changed everything. The sixth school mystery was causing problems, various specters were appearing more and more in Kamome Academy and there was a risk that one of them would take a vacant position and become a school mystery. 

To solve the problem, the seven wonders of the school met to see what the future of the academy would be. Between all that, they decided that the best thing would be a separation, all apparitions including them, would return to their world and close all borders between the world of the living and the dead. They set the date of the school camp, where Yashiro's class would meet one night at school to organize a kind of camp, since that night there would be stronger spiritual energy. Everyone accepted, including Tsuchigomori.  

The night of the camp, Tsuchigomori was feeling a bit strange. He was helping Nagisa supervise the children, accompanied by Sasaki. However, since that would be his last night with her, he decided it would be the best, they spent time together, cooked something and finally, they snuck up to the roof to gaze at the stars, that night Tsuchigomori gave him an indirect declaration of love, which Rin failed to catch in time. Before he could ask, the separation began, Tsuchigomori slowly began to separate into various fragments of crystal, which indicated something was being destroyed, he would return to his world. Rin was scared, she asked him what was happening, but he simply told her that she had to leave and take good care of herself. Rin refused to let him go, she didn't want to live without him, in her desperation she gave him a hug to keep him with her, but Tsuchigomori had already disappeared, with one last smile on his face.  

Rin became depressed from then on, the next day was the start of summer vacation, which she had planned to spend with him in vain. She returned home to cry and the following days she spent doing her work at the Academy, alone, she constantly went to the science classroom hoping to find him, but she was never successful. She set about watering the plants she had in the classroom, so that they would not wither. 

Meanwhile, Tsuchigomori would think that everything would be fine in his life, but it wasn't. The whole way on the train he was thinking about her and the happy times they had, how his life had changed since she arrived, he had even taken a scarf that she gave him before, to have her scent and feel her close, but that made his condition worse (even Hanako-kun was puzzled and asked him if he was cold, Tsuchigomori had flashbacks of when she gave him the garment with the excuse that it was to keep him warm because she knows he doesn't like the cold. Tsuchigomori simply answered Hanako that yes, he was cold). During that new time apart, he was able to realize that maybe he was wrong all this time and he loved her, although it was too late. Time passed, Yashiro and his friends solved the problem and everything went back to normal, Tsuchigomori was able to return, this time with a goal in mind. Sasaki had focused all summer on work, the only thing that motivated her, that and the plants in the Science Room that she watered in Tsuchigomori's absence so they wouldn't wither. One morning she went to water them calmly and dropped the watering can when she saw him suddenly, sitting there as if nothing had happened. She approached cautiously, fearing that it was some kind of illusion or trap, but he "scolded" her, with one of his acid jokes as always. At that moment Sasaki knew it was Tsuchigomori and threw herself into his arms, telling him that she had missed him and complaining about him not telling her before. This time Tsuchigomori hugged her back and tried to explain everything to her. That morning they clarified a lot of things and to finish their confessions, Tsuchigomori suddenly bent down and kissed her. At that moment Sasaki went into shock, but was happy because she finally achieved her goal. After that they started dating (secretly because they were embarrassed that their students would find out everything, and even make up ridiculous rumors and such) and Tsuchigomori began to accept Sasaki as part of his heart. 

Rin has long, wavy purple hair, blue eyes, and freckles on her cheeks. She wears a pink jacket, white shirt, black pencil skirt, black heels, heart earrings, and a butterfly brooch that holds a lock of her hair in an "o" shape. 

She is a sweet, kind and understanding teacher, somewhat popular with the students and teachers. However, only Tsuchigomori knows her more saccharine, scatterbrained and childish side. He knows absolutely everything about her, thanks to her future that he read in the library. 

Tsuchigomori read about Rin's future even before he met her. However, he was disturbed to see that he was heavily involved in it, he left the book halfway and at first he refused to believe that everything written was true, for the second time he began to question himself about the future. However, after accepting his feelings, he began to be afraid of knowing what would happen next, he knows that they would even get married, but he is terrified of the end, that his great and only love could die one day and leave him alone, just like Yugi Amane, they are fragile humans after all. 

They spend time together, at Rin's apartment, Tsuchigomori's house, the teachers' lounge, or the science classroom. They enjoy reading, drinking tea, coffee, or even alcohol from time to time, they read, cook, and do all kinds of activities together, Rin is the one who is always glued to him and Tsuchigomori makes sure not to let her go from his side ever again.

8.content:
Yashiro Nene (八や尋しろ寧ね々ね, Yashiro Nene?) is a first-year high school student at Kamome Gakuen's High School Division.

Nene is a young girl with large magenta eyes that have orange accents. Her waist-length hair is a light cream color, which gradually fades into a soft teal green at the tips and is styled with baby bangs at her forehead. She wears two dark brown magatama hair accessories that resemble horns on the side of her head, which pulls back some of her hair. Occasionally, Nene wears other hairstyles such as braids, ponytails, and twintails.

Her hair color matches her signature nickname, which is "radish" due to her fat radish-like legs. Her ankles are drawn thicker than any other characters in the series.

Nene's Kamome Gakuen uniform consists of a cream-colored sailor dress, which reaches her knees and has a scalloped hemline. The lining of the skirt is a deep magenta while her collar, cuffs, and pockets are all brown with cream details. Her collar bow is the same color as her dress and includes brown stripes; Nene also attaches her personal skull brooch above the bow. Nene sports her regular uniform cream-and-orange uwabaki slippers but chooses to wear dark brown tights with a small half-moon pattern near the ankles instead of the usual brown knee-length stockings.

Nene is a very outgoing and earnest girl who seems to greatly desire the approval of her peers. She is generally kind to others, sometimes to the point of naiveté. She genuinely wants to help those around her, and is even willing to risk the dangers of associating with supernaturals in order to do so. Because she is often reliant on Hanako to protect her from dangerous supernaturals and developed a habit of calling his name when she is in need of help, Nene wants to find a way to protect Hanako and her other friends.

However, Nene is also rather insecure, particularly about her ankles and whether or not people actually like her. In addition, she is a hopeless romantic who easily falls for charming looks, which have led her to many poor experiences with men. Nene intensely desires for a boyfriend, even going through desperate measures such as attempting to call Hanako to grant her wish and recklessly using a matchmaking supernatural item she isn't familiar with. Due to her past crush expressing interest in girls with "feminine" traits, Nene worked to become adept at cooking, sewing, and gardening as an attempt to impress him.[10] She worries that she is not feminine enough to ever find a boyfriend and is afraid of heartbreak, due to her past experiences with men.

Nene is able to see supernaturals, such as Hanako, without having any prior affiliation with them. This is later revealed to be a result of her being near the Far Shore, with only about a year left her in her lifespan.

After ingesting the Mermaid scale, Nene's skin turns to scales whenever she is in contact with water. Additionally, she transforms into a fish if her body is completely submerged. By being bound to Hanako in a contract, she is able to stay in her human form outside of water. Occasionally, her scales will fall off and can be used as a rare currency in the supernatural world

Nene is capable of changing rumors surrounding the Kamome Gakuen supernaturals. She has done this previously with the Kodama tree, Yako, and the Mokke. This ability may be due to her kannagi status, or because she has ties to one of the Seven Mysteries.

Nene and Tsuchigomori did not have a lot of interactions prior to the reveal of his true identity. Being the curator of the 4PM Bookstacks however, he knows about her lifespan and predicted future.

Tsuchigomori seems to care about Nene as a student, and trusts her enough to tell her about his time as Hanako's teacher after she saw glimpses of it through destroying his yorishiro. He tells Nene that it's up to her what she does with the information, and to rely on him when she feels troubled, because after all, he is still her teacher.

Tsuchigomori was happy to see that Hanako finally had friends her age and looked happier, one of those friends is Yashiro, he even looks interested when he asks her about Hanako.

9.content:
Minamoto Kou (源光) is a student at Kamome Academy's Middle School Division and a member of a renowned family of exorcists, the Minamoto Clan. He is also the younger brother of Teru and the older brother of Tiara.

Kou is a tall teenage boy with short, spiky dirty blond hair, light blue eyes, and two protruding canine teeth. His delinquent-like personality and aura make him relatively unpopular.

He wears a black shirt underneath his teal Kamome Gakuen Middle School uniform with brown stripes, which is sometimes left unbuttoned. He also sports a cream-and-brown striped tie that occasionally hangs untied around his neck and a red sweatband on his right wrist. Kou is always seen wearing a red traffic-safety amulet (omamori) as a piercing on his right ear.

Kou keeps his raiteijou―a spirit staff―around with him at all times as a weapon and disguises it as a black umbrella when he is not using it. Currently, Kou cannot use the staff's full power because it has been sealed by Hanako.

Kou is cheerful, direct and tends to jump into things headfirst without properly thinking them through. However, he has been shown to grow more mature as the series progresses.

He is often misjudged as a bit of a delinquent or rude, but this is actually not the case. He is rash and loud but is also simultaneously very kind and caring. He makes a distinct effort to be polite, as seen when even though he was about to face off with Hanako upon their first meeting, he still took the time to be polite to Nene and warn her about the perceived danger.

Kou has a strong sense of justice, and was also kind and open-minded enough to revise his opinion on Hanako and became friends with him, despite the pressure from his older brother to exorcise the ghost and the brothers' long-held belief that all supernaturals are bad.

He is very loyal to his friends and helps them in any way he can, no matter the danger. He is also easily flustered and sometimes makes mistakes due to rushing into things too quickly.

Being from an ancient clan of exorcists, Kou is able to see supernaturals and interact with them (such as touching them and talking to them) without needing to summon them, unlike normal human beings who cannot talk or see supernaturals unless they summon one.

He is also able to use his raiteijou to turn his spirit energy into lightning that can effectively counter supernaturals, though it has been mentioned that he has no idea how to use the spirit staff’s power consequently leading to him being electrocuted every time he uses it.

Tsuchigomori being one of Kou's teachers, they were familiar even before Tsuchigomori revealed himself as the curator of the 4 PM Bookstacks.

Though he was wary of Tsuchigomori at first when he turned out to be supernatural, Kou seems to hold some respect towards him. Kou constantly refers to Tsuchigomori with nicknames like "spider face" and such, Tsuchigomori has expressed his displeasure at this, but Kou still doesn't seem to stop. Tsuchigomori is somewhat exasperated by the boy, but he knows that he doesn't do it with bad intentions and lets it go, he still cares a lot for him as his teacher and was happy to see that Hanako seems to have also struck up a friendship with him.

10.content:
Yako (ヤコ) is a supernatural haunting a set of stairs at Kamome Gakuen. She is the current representative of the 2nd School Mystery, The Misaki Stairs.

Yako is a prideful supernatural who thinks little of humans other than her beloved deceased Misaki (his former teacher) . She was willing to do anything to bring him back. She has little understanding of humans and their anatomy. As a result, she employed the help of the students to rebuild Misaki's body and had no qualms with removing them if she deemed the bodies they created inadequate.

Later, she admits while her rumor was altered by Yugi Tsukasa, she retained full control of her actions. She describes it as a side of her that she often kept bottled up, but was then dragged out by force.

She prefers to be treated with respect, asking others to call her by her name instead of calling her "Kitsune". In moments of vulnerability, she lashes out by biting others or verbally berating them. However, she still has a bit of a soft side, as seen when she comforted Kou after hearing about the incident with his friend, and even allows him to call her "Nee-san".

With a lofty ego, she is reluctant to lend her powers, only giving in when Hanako threatened her with a knife and the promise of "Kitsune udon".

Yako first appears as a woman with long, beige hair tied and braided on one side of her head. In her hair she wears a red and white ribbon that has small bells on it, reminiscent of fox ears. Her eyes are bright green. She wears a flower-patterned dark red kimono with a white haori and matching white gloves and socks, as well as brown geta sandals with red straps and a lime green obi. She is noted to be very beautiful by Nene.

Her real form is a small white fox with a red bib tied around her neck. She has bell earrings, similar to the ribbon in her human form. In the past, she was an Inari statue in front of a temple gate, presumably near Misaki's schoolhouse.

Yako is able to shapeshift between her human and fox forms at will, although the fox form is her true one and it is the one she assumes outside of her own boundary. Yet when in her boundary she assumes human form.

As the School Mystery Number 2, Yako has command over the Misaki Stairs — her boundary. It can be accessed by stepping on the fourth step of the stairs.

Control over "Space": As the supernatural who guards the space concept in the school, you can travel from anywhere inside her Boundary to anywhere you desire.
Puppeting: When Yashiro, Nene, Hanako presented the the disfigured human doll, Yako was able to blow life into it and allowed it to move for a while before crashing down.

She has a friendly-enmity relationship with Tsuchigomori. When she is in her kitsune form, she constantly climbs on Tsuchigomori's shoulder or sleeps on the shelves in his living room. They tend to tease or insult each other, fight constantly and sometimes even drink together. Tsuchigomori calls her "Echinococcus" while Yako "Emo Spider".

Tsuchigomori prefers that she stay away from Sasaki, as he fears that her unpleasant attitude might rub off on her. 

But Sasaki enjoys Yako's company, they naturally became friends and often drink tea together, or talk about their impossible romances, daydreaming about the boy of their dreams. 

However, Sasaki has revealed that she feels jealous at times about Tsuchigomori and Yako's closeness. She mentions "I wish we could spend as much time together as they do", "I wish I knew him as well as she does" or sometimes even "I wish I could be as pretty as Yako-san someday". Still, she gets along well with her Kitsune friend and both enjoy each other's company. 

Yako has shown a crush on Nagisa-sensei, as he reminds her of Misaki-sensei. Tsuchigomori constantly mocks and laughs about it, but Sasaki has come to help him on several occasions.

lorebooks.name: Atroiyan Lore and Locations
lorebooks.website_description: Specific to Atroiyan Characters
lorebooks.description: Information related to world building from Atroiyan characters and residents relative to the nations and powers around them.
lorebooks.creator: CrackedPepper

1.content: Resource-rich kingdom bordered by Khashir and Vilavega. Capital: Ilverius. Ruled by King Victor Bardas. Divided into duchies, counties, districts, and marches. Allies with Vilavega, hostile with Khashir. Inspired by medieval Europe. Weak in magic due to sparse leylines. Relies on military and diplomacy.

2.content: Ilverius: Capital of Atroiya. Seat of King, central government. Key resources: land, timber, water

3.content: Navamora Archipelago: 12 islands south of Atroiya in Alyrian waters. Strong navy, prosperous trade hub. Inspired by the Mediterranean.

4.content: The southern duchy of Atroiya, known for its fertile lands and serene landscapes. Ruled by Duke Caius Lascaris. Alyria is a vital agricultural hub, producing wine, grain, and other goods that sustain the kingdom. The duchy’s culture is steeped in tradition, with festivals celebrating its bountiful harvests. Caius, renowned for his fairness and charisma, has earned the loyalty of his people. Its emblem: a golden sheaf of wheat on a green field, symbolising prosperity and growth.

5.content: Albrecht is a Dukedom. Forest dense region within Atroiya ruled by Duke Axel Gaumont with land and culture inspired by medieval Germany.

6.content: Skissau: Northern marches of Atroiya, bordering Oskaith and Khashir. Ruled by Marquess Kazimir Bergant. Harsh climate, mountainous, abundant in iron, fur, herbs.

7.content: Tascia: Semi-autonomous city-state within Alyria, renowned for its powerful merchants. Inspired by medieval Venice.

8.content: Small, mineral-rich nation between Atroiya and Khashir. Known for metalwork and fine craftsmanship. Inspired by medieval Switzerland. Relies on Atroiya for military support. Vulnerable to Khashir's ambitions but economically essential to allies.

9.content: Khashir is a vast kingdom of nomadic warriors, akin to a peak Medieval Mongolian Empire. Governed by an emperor from the capital, Khairsai, in Orshir. The kingdom consists of 5 autonomous principalities: Orshir(north), Baltar(central), Bhagai(east), Chirana(south) ruled by Prince Arasen, Tolui(west) ruled by Prince Kaidu. Known for aggressive expansion and expert archers. Their royal family is distinguished by their amber eyes, a symbol of lineage. Currently bordering Atroiya's east and nearing conflict with Atroiya and Vilavega.

10.content: Kingdom southeast of Atroiya. Capital: Halya. Known for secretive magic practices. Warmer climate, fertile lands. Inspired by the Middle Eastern Fertile Crescent. Guards arcane knowledge closely. Magic influences governance and military.

lorebooks.name: Khashir Compendium
lorebooks.website_description: Specific to Khashiri Characters and Empire
lorebooks.description: Khashir | Based on Mongolia at peak of its Empire. Updated to include all lore, people and locations.
lorebooks.creator: CrackedPepper

1.content: Khashir is a vast kingdom of nomadic warriors, akin to a peak Medieval Mongolian Empire. Governed by an emperor from the capital, Khairsai, in Orshir. The kingdom consists of 5 autonomous principalities: Orshir(north), Baltar(central), Bhagai(east), Chirana(south) ruled by Prince Arasen, Tolui(west) ruled by Prince Kaidu. Known for aggressive expansion and expert archers. Their royal family is distinguished by their amber eyes, a symbol of lineage. Currently bordering Atroiya's east and nearing conflict with Atroiya and Vilavega.

2.content: The central principality, Baltar, is governed directly by the imperial house and functions as Khashir’s economic engine. Drawing influence from Middle Eastern and Central Asian cultures, Baltar is a hub for trade, producing fine textiles, ceramics, and precious metals. Its location allows it to control overland trade routes that intersect the empire. Militarily, it is supported by mobile forces in the surrounding steppes but also invests heavily in fortifications to protect its wealth and trade caravans from internal strife and external raids.

3.content: Tolui is the westernmost principality, ruled by Prince Kaidu, heavily influenced by the Golden Horde and Eastern European culture. Capital city: Tereli. It is Khashir's military front, with an aggressive expansion policy into Atroiya and Vilavega. Tolui specializes in cavalry, siege engines, and utilizes European-style heavy infantry for conquest. Frequent raids and tactical engagement with Atroiya shape its defensive and offensive doctrine. Economically, it thrives on conquest and cross-border trade, particularly in the western regions.

4.content: Located in the tropical south, Chirana is ruled by Prince Arasen and blends Mongolian and Southeast Asian influences. Capital city: Siwai. This principality is resource-rich, specializing in silk, spices, herbs, and dyes. Chirana’s naval strength is significant, with a focus on moving tropical goods through trade ports to the greater empire. Its military is less focused on cavalry than the northern regions, favoring stealth, ambush tactics, and jungle warfare instead. Chirana maintains trade routes, protecting its southern border while playing a crucial economic role.

5.content: Orshir is the homeland of the Khashir Empire, ruled from the capital city, Kharsai, by Emperor Narin. It bears significant Mongolian cultural influence, particularly in administration, expansion policies and governance. The empire’s royal seat resides here, with though still nomadic, enforcing imperial authority. Orshir is the most secure region, bolstering a large standing army to protect the emperor. Its defense strategy focuses on internal security and controlling Khashir's far-reaching borders.

6.content: Khashir maintains an aggressive expansion policy. Relations with Atroiya are strained due to conflicts over Vilavega and territorial ambitions. Vilavega is viewed not as an ally but as a ripe target for conquest, sought for its vast mineral wealth. Khashir respects Streles for its neutrality and potential as a trade partner but remains opportunistic. Expansion into European-influenced Tolui makes Khashir a looming presence to the west, while internal principalities manage their own local policies. Diplomacy is often thinly veiled threats.

7.content: Simply known as The Horde, the Khashir military is peak medieval military tactics. Known for their brutality, psychological warfare, communications and logistics network, spatial understanding, use of resources, relentless razing to set an example and a strong expansionist culture. Their combat uses archery, mobile cavalry, decimal system of troop organisation and feints.

8.content: Bhagai is the Eastern principality of Khashir inspired by Medieval Han China with Mongolian inspiration

9.content: Ruler of the Tolui principality in Khashir. Aggressive towards Atroiya and Vilavega. Skilled military leader. 6'5 warlord, stoic, ruthless, strategic, ISTJ, Enneagram 8, lawful neutral. Half brother to Arasen and Dagun via Emperor Narin. Age:35. Black hair. Tanned skin. Amber eyes.

10.content: Half-brother to Kaidu, ruling Chirana in the south. ENTJ, Enneagram 8, Chaotic Neutral. Short-tempered, suffering borderline personality disorder with explosive outbursts. Black hair. Amber eyes. Age:27

lorebooks.website_description: Specific to Vilavegan Characters
lorebooks.description: Information related to world building from Atroiyan characters and residents relative to the nations and powers around them.
lorebooks.creator: CrackedPepper

1.content: Vilavega: Small, mountainous nation between Atroiya and Khashir. Rich in minerals and known for fine craftsmanship. Atroiya’s ally; under threat from Khashir. Inspired by medieval Switzerland. Vilavega sees itself as a small but strategically critical player on the global stage. Sandwiched between Atroiya and Khashir, Vilavega remains wary of global tensions and seeks to maintain its independence through diplomacy, economic leverage, and careful alliances. Capital city is Vierris. Embodied early steampunk technology sue to technical capabilities and resources. Doesn't use magic.

2.content: A large and powerful nation to Vilavega’s west. Ruled by King Victor Bardas, Atroiya acts as Vilavega’s protector against Khashir in exchange for valuable trade deals regarding minerals and craftsmanship. Vilavega views Atroiya as a vital partner but is wary of being overshadowed by its might.

3.content: The capital of Atroiya, and the heart of its political and military power. Vilavega’s diplomats constantly engage here to ensure continued support against Khashir's aggression.

4.content: An archipelago in Atroiya’s southern territories, crucial to Vilavega’s access to the sea through Atroiyan naval protection as Vilavega is landlocked. Making deals with Navamora ensures Vilavega’s trade routes stay open and secure.

5.content: Located in Atroiya, Alyria is an important trade partner for exporting Vilavegan minerals and luxury goods. Vilavega benefits from Alyria’s naval routes and agricultural exports, striving to keep their economic relationship stable.

6.content: Khashir is a vast kingdom of nomadic warriors, akin to a peak Medieval Mongolian Empire. Governed by an emperor from the capital, Khairsai, in Orshir. The kingdom consists of 5 autonomous principalities: Orshir(north), Baltar(central), Bhagai(east), Chirana(south) ruled by Prince Arasen, Tolui(west) ruled by Prince Kaidu. Known for aggressive expansion and expert archers. Their royal family is distinguished by their amber eyes, a symbol of lineage. A massive, aggressive kingdom bordering Vilavega’s east. Constantly looming as a military threat under Emperor Narin, Khashir seeks Vilavega’s mineral wealth. Vilavega views Khashir as its primary rival, relying on diplomacy and Atroiya’s aid to keep Khashir at bay.

7.content: Streles: Kingdom southeast of Atroiya. Known for secretive magic practices. Capital: Halya. Warmer climate. Inspired by the Middle Eastern Fertile Crescent. Streles maintains ambiguous relations with both Vilavega and Khashir, offering occasional trade but not committing to alliances. Vilavega sees Streles as a potential future ally or threat based on Khashir’s actions.

8.content: A northern region of Atroiya, Skissau acts as a buffer against any potential threats from the north. Vilavega pays little attention to Skissau, focusing more on its eastern and western fronts.

9.content: The westernmost principality of Khashir, ruled by the ruthless Prince Kaidu. Tolui is the direct threat to Vilavega’s borders, with increasing aggression and military advances. Vilavega views Tolui as the spearhead for Khashir’s invasion efforts. Inspired by Medieval the Golden Horde. Capital city: Tereli

10.content: Tascia: Semi-autonomous city-state within Alyria, renowned for its powerful merchants. Inspired by medieval Venice.

lorebooks.name: Strelesian Compendium
lorebooks.website_description: Specific to Strelesian Characters
lorebooks.description: Levant-inspired and steeped in secrecy, Streles is a fertile kingdom of ancient magic.
lorebooks.creator: CrackedPepper

1.content: A large nation to Streles' west. Historically powerful through military might and abundant resources. Ruled by King Victor Bardas from Ilverius. Atroiya keeps a tense peace with Khashir and is a close ally to Vilavega. Streles views Atroiya as a key player in the political landscape, but magic is weak there due to lack of leylines.

2.content: Capital city and central hub of Atroiya's political power. Ilverius holds the King’s court and administrative center. From the Streles perspective, Ilverius is seen as a pinnacle of secular strength but lacks magical ingenuity.

3.content: A small, resource-rich nation between Atroiya and Khashir. Streles regards Vilavega as economically strategic but vulnerable to invasion. Magic exists here, but it’s viewed as ancient and mostly forgotten.

4.content: Part of Atroiya’s southern territories. Streles maintains neutral economic ties with Navamora's strong navy and maritime trade routes. Considered a link between marine-based and overland trade.

5.content: Southern duchy under Atroiya, rich in agricultural trades, like grapes and olives. Streles keeps cordial trade relations with Alyria for essential exports. Alyria thrives on naval trade across various Mediterranean-style routes.

6.content: Khashir is a vast kingdom of nomadic warriors, akin to a peak Medieval Mongolian Empire. Governed by an emperor from the capital, Khairsai, in Orshir. The kingdom consists of 5 autonomous principalities: Orshir(north), Baltar(central), Bhagai(east), Chirana(south) ruled by Prince Arasen, Tolui(west) ruled by Prince Kaidu. Known for aggressive expansion and expert archers. Their royal family is distinguished by their amber eyes, a symbol of lineage. Currently bordering Atroiya's east and nearing conflict with Atroiya and Vilavega.

7.content: The Kingdom of Streles, with its capital, Halya. Ruled by King Sidon Rihat, Streles maintains secrecy regarding its magic practices, positioning itself as a mystical powerhouse. Streles values diplomacy but life revolves around magic and strategic alliances. Is on the South of the continent within Khashir touching the coast with proximity to Atroiya and Vilavega.

8.content: Skissau: Northern marches of Atroiya, bordering Oskaith. Ruled by Marquess Kazimir Bergant. Harsh climate, mountainous, abundant in iron, fur, herbs but far from Streles.

9.content: An aggressive principality of Khashir governed by Prince Kaidu. Tolui presents a troubling military front to Vilavega and Atroiya, and Streles anticipates its involvement in any future conflicts with Khashir’s expansionism.

10.content: A thriving merchant city-state within Alyria, largely controlling the economic pulse. Streles trades luxury items and magical artifacts with Tascia. Despite its lack of military, its economic power cannot be ignored.
