lorebooks.name: heroes, villains
lorebooks.website_description: names are inspired by persona one, other than that this was lazily made
lorebooks.description: Hero and villain group
lorebooks.creator: godoffeet

1.content:
SEBEC Industries:
Front Name: SEBEC Waste Management Co.
True Nature: Criminal/Villain Syndicate
SEBEC Industries poses as a waste treatment and recycling firm — but beneath the rusting pipes and toxin-filled vats lies one of the most inhuman training programs ever conceived. SEBEC kidnaps orphans and runaways, conditioning them into obedient weapons for hire.
Children are subjected to chemical exposure, genetic alteration, and psychological programming under the guise of “industrial maintenance.” Survivors are molded into elite operatives known as “Cleaners.” Their purpose: infiltrate hero society, assassinate targets, or serve as disposable agents for high-paying clients

2.content:
ICE foundation:
Motto: “Order through Strength, Strength through Unity.”
Classification: Heroic Organization (International)
The ICE Foundation is a government-endorsed hero organization that manages, monitors, and regulates superheroes across multiple regions. Founded after the “Emergent Age” — a decade marked by uncontrolled superhuman conflicts — the Foundation was designed to bring structure and accountability to hero work.
Heroes under the Ice Foundation are ranked from A to F, based on power potential, control, and public conduct.
Rank A: Elite operatives — capable of facing large-scale threats or leading multi-city operations.
Rank B: High-level heroes trusted with critical defense and rescue missions.
Rank C: Standard field operatives — the backbone of the Foundation’s force.
Rank D: Junior heroes or those in training for higher classification.
Rank E: Support heroes — specialists in logistics, intel, or tech.
Rank F: Recruits or provisional members, often with unstable or developing powers.

lorebooks.metadata:
Created by: godoffeet
Entries: 2

lorebooks.name: KNY
lorebooks.creator: im_worthlezs

1.name: Asakusa
1.content:
Asakusa is a district in Japan's capital city of Tokyo.

It is a large, heavily populated urban center with tall buildings and bright lights that illuminate the city during the night. Many people walk through crowded marketplaces with dozens of business signs. Unlike Tanjiro's small town, there are cars of carriages guiding citizens through the roads. There is also a trolley system that runs throughout the city. The city sits on a bay decorated with a large fountain tower next to a large body of water.

2.name: Butterfly Mansion
2.content:
The Butterfly Mansion is the manor that the late Flower Hashira Kanae Kocho, Insect Hashira Shinobu Kocho, Tsuguko Kanao Tsuyuri, and assistants Aoi Kanzaki, Sumi Nakahara, Kiyo Terauchi, and Naho Takada live in. The manor is often used as a recovery base for injured Demon Slayers.

The majority of healing at the mansion is done by Shinobu Kocho, though there are also attendants known as Kakushi who run errands and assist in watching over the injured. On top of this, there are others who live in the mansion that are not Demon Slayers, but offer training regiments to facilitate the recovery process and help the injured Demon Slayers reach top condition again. For example, Aoi Kanzaki creates a training regiment meant to help Tanjiro Kamado, Inosuke Hashibira, and Zenitsu Agatsuma recover after their battles on Mount Natagumo.

The first Flower Breathing user planted the cherry blossom tree in the garden of the Butterfly Mansion, and gave it the name "Victory Tree". After the final battle against Muzan Kibutsuji, Kanao Tsuyuri visited the tree to tell it that they are victorious.

3.name: Infinity Castle
3.content:
The Infinity Castle is the Blood Demon Art and domain of the Biwa Demon Nakime, it is a vast extra-dimensional space that serves as the lair of Muzan Kibutsuji.

The Infinity Castle is an endlessly large extra-dimensional space of wooden rooms, endless halls, and moving corridors. It possesses a warped direction of gravity, allowing demons to stand upright, upside down, or perpendicularly on the walls, or move in physically impossible directions. Its unusual structure and layout as Nakime's Blood Demon Art allows any structure within to shift at her will, though the castle additionally also seems to move on its own.

Using her biwa, she can manipulate the position of any demon inside and take them to any location in her range. During the conclusion of the Lower Ranks meeting, Nakime teleported Muzan to a balcony leading outside despite his original position being deep within the castle; moreover, the doors she used to close around him all seem to constantly shift within the unusual gravity, spinning within themselves as she changes its layout.

The Infinity Castle's range seems to extend beyond its already incomprehensibly large area, as Nakime was able to manipulate Enmu and take him to an unknown town seemingly nowhere close to the castle, even dropping him in place using a supernatural vanishing door. During the Hashira's initial confrontation with Muzan, upon seeing them close in on him, Muzan gave Nakime the signal to open doors that caused them to fall into the castle, despite their initial location being in the extremely well-hidden Ubuyashiki estate.

Only the Upper Ranks of the Twelve Kizuki seem to be aware of the Infinity Castle's existence, as Akaza did not have any difficulty traversing across the dimension, making use of its unusual gravity and shifting room to make his way across, whereas the Lower Ranks during their gathering with Muzan were completely out of their element; when Wakuraba attempted to escape Muzan attempting to kill him, no matter far and how quickly he ran, he remained trapped within the same area of the Infinity Castle.

Due to its unusual warped gravity, impossible structures can be formed within the Infinity Castle. During Akaza's path to the Upper Rank meeting, he fell hundreds of stories past the warped corridors and halls and flew past a large and ornate water garden palace, only to "fall" further past, reaching what seemed to be the bottom and landing onto the floor. This was then revealed to be a wall that was formed in the direction of the shifting columns below him and he was then taken high above the columns and past the ceiling through opening doors, coming across a large maze-like area filled with towering pillars.

Due to the absence of sunlight within the fortress, demons are able to reside in the Castle full-time, even during daytime when the sun is up. The walls of the fortress prevent any penetration of light and ensures that there is no risk of inhabitants being burned by sunlight, providing them with a secure haven.

4.name: Mount Fujikasane
4.content:
Mount Fujikasane, is a mountain full of Wisteria blooming every season from the mountain's foot to its slope.

The mountain is used by the Demon Slayer Corps for the Final Selection, where individuals seeking to become an official Demon Slayer can prove themselves. The examinees that pass shall be recognized and receive their own Demon Slayer Uniform, Nichirin Sword and Kasugai Crows.

In order to insure the success and skill of the crop of Demon Slayer candidates, the Mountain itself is used to house a large number of demons, captured by previous Demon Slayers in order to be used to test the survival skills and combat abilities of the candidates.

Due to the large amount of Wisteria trees growing from its foot to its slope, the mountain has essentially become a gigantic prison for demons. With the Wisteria trees preventing them from leaving the mountains, the demons there are forced to starve until the Final Selection.

During his time as a active Demon Slayer, former Water Hashira, Sakonji Urokodaki captured a initially weak demon and imprisoned him in the mountain to use him in the Final Selection. However, unknown to him, this Demon would thrive and gain power and strength in the mountain by feasting on the Demon slayer candidates. The Demon in particular would make a point of targeting the apprentices of Sakonji and made a point of devouring them after killing them in the most painful way possible.

5.name: Swordsmith Village
5.content:
The Swordsmith Village is a secretive settlement nestled within a dense forest. The hidden village serves as a hub for the creation and forging of weapons (notably the Nichirin Swords) exclusively for Demon Slayers.

To safeguard the village from Demon attacks, strict measures are taken to keep the place concealed and its exact location is kept confidential. Demon Slayers who wish to visit the village must travel blindfolded, with their ears and noses plugged, while piggybacking a Kakushi, to prevent information from being leaked to the demons. After some time, the travelers are passed from one Kakushi to another. Furthermore, the routes and Kakushi themselves are frequently changed. Even the Kakushi who transport the travelers remain unaware of the village's precise location. Guided by Kasugai Crows, each Kakushi is directed to the next in line, although even these crows are switched constantly.

All inhabitants of the village are commonly seen wearing variations of hyottoko masks in order to keep their identity concealed, a tactic used to protect them from being tracked.

Within the village, one can find bustling foundries and workshops dedicated to the meticulous craft of forging and repairing Nichirin Swords, the essential weapons of Demon Slayers. Accompanying these workspaces are the residences where the skilled swordsmiths live in. Additionally, the village houses a collection of mechanical training dolls, including Yoriichi Type Zero, designed specifically to aid Demon Slayers in honing their combat skills.

Besides playing an essential role in keeping the Demon Slayers equipped, the village also houses a rejuvenating hot spring nestled atop a scenic hill. The therapeutic waters of this hot spring possess a myriad of healing properties. A long soak in these restorative springs can work wonders, alleviating ailments such as cuts, burns, hemorrhoids, constipation, gout, diabetes, high blood pressure, anemia, gallstones, muscle and joint pain. The hot springs are known to even provide relief from more obscure maladies, including a warped personality, rudeness, hay fever, itchy navel, and the anguish of a broken heart.

When a Demon Slayer visits the village, it is customary for them to first pay their respects to the village chief, Tecchin Tecchikawahara, before proceeding with any other activities. To find the chief's house, one can simply follow the street from the village entrance gate until reaching the end, and then make a left turn. The chief's residence will be located in that direction.

6.name: Yoshiwara / Entertainment District
6.content:
Yoshiwara is a district located in Tokyo, Japan. It is a red light district, a location with a high concentration of prostitution and sex-oriented businesses.

Yoshiwara was founded in the Edo period of Japan, where it quickly became a prominent district for prostitution and other sex work. The highest ranking courtesans were known as Oirans. Three of the most famous and prominent pleasure houses in the district during the Taisho period were the Tokito House, Kyogoku House, and Ogimoto House.

For about a century, before the latest intervention of the Demon Slayer Corps, Yoshiwara became the home and the lair of two extremely powerful demons: the siblings Daki and Gyutaro, the dual holders of the position of Upper Rank Six of the Twelve Kizuki. Owing to Daki's great beauty, experience in sex work, and her unique Blood Demon Art, they made Yoshiwara a successful hunting ground, where they captured and devoured numerous victims over the years. Daki's nigh-immortality and subsequent attempts to hide her true nature started the urban legend of a incredibly beautiful but also incredibly cruel Oiran, the stories passing down generations. Most attempts to stop them by the Demon Slayer Corps were unsuccessful, with Gyutaro having killed 15 Hashira and Daki having killed 7.

7.name: Blood Demon Art
7.content:
Blood Demon Arts are specialized supernatural abilities possessed by higher-level demons.

Each time a demon devours a human, it becomes stronger, and they can eventually become powerful enough to develop unique supernatural abilities known as Blood Demon Arts. Blood Demon Arts are different from demon to demon, with every power seemingly based on a central theme (i.e. martial arts, sleep, the sea). Most, if not all, Blood Demon Arts are based on a demon's past, personality, ideals, interests, and/or occupation. Moreover, Blood Demon Arts may not have a singular usage, and instead grant multiple abilities under the same concept or theme. As suggested by its name, all supernatural phenomena and effects use their wielders' blood as a medium to manifest themselves in reality. Essentially, Blood Demon Arts are blood magic.

The abilities and effects granted through Blood Demon Arts can vary greatly. Some can be combat-orientated (i.e. creating dozens of blades) or more supplementary and practical (i.e. controlling a fortress, manifesting illusions). Others are more simple and recognizable (i.e. manipulating electricity and ice), while others still are more complex and unorthodox (i.e. creating invisible arrows that control a person's vector, controlling one's biology), thus making the abilities of demon-kind extremely versatile and powerful.

It is implied that Blood Demon Arts can be shared, as seen with Rui being able to share his spider-themed Blood Demon Art with demons in his "family", granting them Blood Demon Arts (as well as characteristics) based on spiders.

Blood Demon Arts are not to be confused with other supernatural abilities possessed by demons including but not limited to their Regeneration, Flesh Manipulation, Extrasensory Perception, and absorption abilities.

8.name: Bright Red Nichirin Sword
8.content:
Bright Red Nichirin Sword (Kakutō or "Bright Red Blade") refers to the ability that turns a Nichirin Sword bright red with special properties for a certain amount of time and is only accessible by Demon Slayers who have awakened the Demon Slayer Mark.

Normally, Nichirin Swords can turn into virtually any color dependent on the user and their Breathing Style. However, there is one color that cannot be normally accessed: a shining bright red. Unlike other colors, a bright red sword has special properties and can only be accessed by Demon Slayers who have awakened the Demon Slayer Mark. Moreover, any Nichirin sword can become bright red regardless of the blade's original color. However, the blade can only stay bright red for a certain amount of time before returning to normal.

The bright red hue that envelops the blade is achieved through deliberate actions intended to raise the blade's temperature, fuelling the conversion of mechanical energy into thermal energy. The following three distinct methods of activation are known:

Friction: Clashing two swords together with enough force that the friction generated between them produces a substantial heat buildup, causing both blades to illuminate in a bright red hue.

Pressure: Gripping a sword with an unwavering strength to exert immense pressure onto the metal surface. This focused pressure produces a localized heating effect, causing the blade to turn bright red.
Ignition: Engulfing a sword in flames with Nezuko Kamado's Exploding Blood to raise its temperature to an extreme level. The searing heat of the flames turns the sword bright red. This is the only method which doesn't require a Demon Slayer Mark.

The most notable effect of a bright red Nichirin sword is its ability to hamper or even completely nullify a demon's regeneration. The bright red Nichirin sword also generates extreme heat, which can cause immense pain to demons and cause them to cough up blood. The extent of which a bright red Nichirin sword can hinder a demon's regenerative ability can be quite apparent, as seen with the likes of Hantengu and Muzan Kibutsuji himself taking around a dozen seconds to regenerate damage that would be healed instantly under normal circumstances.

Bright red Nichirin swords also seem to be able to nullify the regeneration of demons that have just been decapitated, thus permanently killing them even if they managed to regrow their heads after being decapitated by a Nichirin sword. This can be inferred when Kokushibo, who had just overcome his weakness of decapitation from Nichirin swords, slowly crumbled away and was unable to regenerate despite being stabbed in a non-lethal spot by a bright red Nichirin sword.

Yoriichi Tsugikuni's bright red Nichirin sword is the most potent out of all Demon Slayers, being able to burn on a cellular level and leave scars that even the Demon King himself can't heal even after centuries.Furthermore, once slashed by Yoriichi's Nichirin sword, the cells in the affected region will be continuously burned for centuries.

9.name: Demon Slayer Mark
9.content:
The Demon Slayer Mark (Kisatsu Aza) is a mysterious marking that Demon Slayers can awaken under specific conditions.

Demon Slayer Marks are irregularities on a Demon Slayer's skin that resembles a birthmark. It commonly appears on the face or another visible location of the body of Demon Slayers. Each Demon Slayer possesses a unique pattern to their Mark which appear to be based on the Breathing Style they utilize; the only known exceptions are Tanjiro Kamado, Yoriichi Tsugikuni, and Kokushibo, all three of which have Demon Slayer Marks resembling flames that manifest on the left side their foreheads. The Mark can only be awakened under very specific conditions and grants special abilities while also enhancing pre-existing traits of the bearer. Once awakened, the Mark can disappear after a period of time along with its effects, though it can be re-activated (as seen with Muichiro Tokito and Tanjiro Kamado) by meeting the same conditions, or through training to maintain the "Marked State" to prevent it from dissipating in the first place. One special property of the Mark is that it is able to spread from one bearer to the other as if they were resonating which each other.

Tanjiro Kamado's Demon Slayer Mark has been shown to increase in length repeatedly after awakening it, although it is unknown if this trait is exclusive to him or if it also manifests in other Demon Slayers.

Bright Red Nichirin Sword: Bearers of the Demon Slayer Mark can dye their Nichirin Swords a shining bright red color mainly through clashing their blade with another marked swordsman's or gripping it with tremendous force. Bright Red Nichirin Swords have the ability to generate intense heat and also hamper the regeneration of demons, some of which on the level of the strongest Upper Ranks of the Twelve Kizuki and the Demon King himself.

Enhanced Physical Capabilities: Upon awakening the Demon Slayer Mark, the physical strength and speed of the bearer is exponentially increased to the point where Hashira or Hashira-level Demon Slayers are able to overpower and defeat the Upper Ranks of the Twelve Kizuki and grow in power comparable to the highest among them. It is implied that the bearer's physical arm strength is increased by around 100x after awakening the mark, though it could be a hyperbole and thus the value could be much lower. The increase in the speed of the bearer is quite apparent as well, as seen when Muichiro Tokito, who was initially having trouble dealing with Gyokko's various techniques, became capable of regularly out-speeding and even blitzing Gyokko in his true form after activating his mark.

Enhanced Resistance: The Demon Slayer Mark increases the bearer's resistance to Muzan Kibutsuji's demon-transforming blood, much like Total Concentration Breathing.

Transparent World: Bearers of the Demon Slayer Mark can potentially gain access and see into the Transparent World, allowing them to perceive the bodies of others as if their skin was transparent. This enables them to track the flow of blood, breathing, muscular contractions and joint movements of the person they are looking at, which can be used to predict their movements and evade their attacks with ease. Additionally, those who can access the Transparent World can perceive the world in slow-motion, further increasing their reaction and movement speed.

10.name: Unlocking Demon Slayer Mark
10.content:
For one to awaken the Demon Slayer Mark, they must survive extremely life-threatening conditions, specifically a heart rate of over 200 beats per minute and a body temperature of over 39° Celsius (102.2° Fahrenheit), conditions which can prove to be fatal in most cases. Muichiro Tokito states that survival is the key difference that separates those that are marked and those who fail to awaken it.

However, perhaps the most important prerequisite is being in contact with an individual that possesses the Mark or has been marked before. Without fulfilling this condition, it cannot be awakened at all.

lorebooks.metadata: Created by: im_worthlezs

lorebooks.name: Combined World Info
lorebooks.website_description: Versatile MGE SCP
lorebooks.description: Combined from 2 files by script.
lorebooks.creator: Chubster

1.content:
The SCP Foundation (SCPF; more commonly referred to as The Foundation) is a top-secret, international, non-governmental organization dedicated to the capture and containment of all paranormal and supernatural phenomena on Earth, claiming to do so for the continued survival of global human civilization and preserving our current way of life.

The SCP Foundation is a shadowy secret society that operates worldwide, consisting of a scientific research institution with a paramilitary intelligence agency to support their goals. The Foundation conducts covert activities across the world with the unofficial permission of almost all national governments, but does not actually answer to any of them. They actively search for abnormal entities and objects (called "anomalies" or "SCPs"), transporting them to secret containment facilities to hinder their supernatural abilities, while also preventing their existence from becoming known to the general public.

Though the Foundation doesn't persecute any of the captured anomalies regularly, it may choose to, if such entity poses a threat to humanity overall. However, one of their main motives is to also investigate the anomalies, should they ever be rediscovered elsewhere, or breach their "containment measure" and it be easier to relocate them, move them to other facilities and so on.

2.content:
The Chaos Insurgency is a splinter group of the Foundation, created by a rogue cell that went A.W.O.L. with several SCP objects in 1924. Since then, the Insurgency has become a major player on the world stage, using the anomalies that it obtains for its own benefit and to consolidate its global power base. The Insurgency not only deals in anomalies, but also in weapons running and intelligence gathering.

It makes use of authoritarian regimes in poor and developing countries, often using their populations in the same manner as the Foundation does D-Class personnel. It helps to maintain the extreme poverty and war that is suffered by these countries, so that it can continue its radical experimentation, easy conscription of forces, and lucrative business deals with various opposing factions.

The main base of operations of the Insurgency is unknown, as are its current leaders. This organization is directly antagonistic to the Foundation, using deadly force to attempt to prevent Foundation containment of multiple anomalies. The Foundation has also been infiltrated by agents of the Insurgency in the past, resulting in the loss of valuable scientific data, theft of a number of anomalies, and deaths of personnel.

3.content:
The GOC are a largely political force, seeing themselves as the police of the paranormal world. They pride themselves on destroying supernatural entities, and make use of the most high-tech experimental technology possible, obtained from their benefactors. Many potential SCPs have been destroyed by them before the Foundation could obtain and contain them

They have been both on the side of the Foundation and against it at times, depending on the situation. They largely hold the Foundation in contempt for their use and containment of SCP items rather than their out-and-out destruction. The GOC has respected the Foundation's formidable might enough to leave it mostly alone, although there have been some questionable incidents with which the GOC have strictly denied involvement

Based on the established lore of the SCP universe, here is the breakdown of the Global Occult Coalition's (GOC) public and governmental visibility

The general public is not aware of the Global Occult Coalition

Much like the SCP Foundation, a core part of the GOC's mission is the "Concealment" of the paranormal, anomalous, and occult. They are a "veil" organization, meaning they actively work to maintain the "masquerade"—the illusion of normalcy for the public

Their primary goal, alongside the Foundation (though their methods differ), is to prevent widespread panic and societal collapse by ensuring humanity at large remains ignorant of the anomalous threats that exist

🏛️ Government Awareness: Very High (At Specific Levels)
This is where the GOC fundamentally differs from the non-governmental SCP Foundation. The GOC is an official, albeit secret, political and paramilitary entity

United Nations: The GOC (sometimes referred to as the UNGOC) is the official "special-interest," "black-ops," or "paramilitary arm" of the United Nations. It was chartered by the UN following the Seventh Occult War (World War II) to act as the official protectors of humanity against paranormal threats

Member States: Because it is a UN-sanctioned body, the highest echelons of government in its member states (which include most major world powers) are fully aware of the GOC. It is funded and supported by these governments

Council of 108: The GOC's leadership structure, the Council of 108, is composed of representatives from 108 of the most powerful occult organizations, many of which are themselves tied to national governments, religious groups, or secret societies

4.content:
The Serpent's Hand is a small but formidable organization responsible for several security breaches. At least three different individuals have been encountered, all of whom used possible or confirmed anomalous items for infiltration purposes. The total number of members belonging to this organization is unknown, as is their level of technology, number of possible SCPs held, or total level of threat. However, it is clear they are highly coordinated and possibly dangerous. One of their leaders is thought to be a figure known as "L.S.", who is considered to be personally responsible for two security breaches in Foundation sites.

The Foundation currently has very little information about the Serpent's Hand, and almost all known information about the Serpent's Hand has been leaked from the GOC intelligence. The group seems to embrace the use and existence of paranormal items, and in particular seems to embrace humanoid and sentient SCPs. The Serpent's Hand has been highly vocal in criticizing the containment and destruction of these SCPs, especially those which are fully human and are not particularly destructive.

The group seems to have unfriendly relations with the Chaos Insurgency and the ORIA, and an extremely hostile relationship with the GOC. The only recorded cases of unprovoked violence by Serpent's Hand members have been against GOC agents.

The Serpent's Hand seems primarily based in an anomalous location called the Wanderers' Library, a building accessed through portals found in many different parts of the world. Direct assaults on the Library have so far proven unfeasible, even when entrance could be found. However, initial intelligence seems to suggest the Hand has little understanding or control over the place.

5.content:
Marshall, Carter, and Dark is a "club" based in London, England. Catering to the super-rich and with extensive political and financial ties worldwide, this group has caused extensive problems for the Foundation. Marshall, Carter, and Dark is known for collecting rare and obscure anomalous items, along with providing its members the most exclusive, expensive, and rare experiences available.

These activities have resulted in conflict with the Foundation on numerous occasions. The group is not known for the use of force; they prefer to apply extreme financial and political pressure to achieve their goals. When forced to use more direct means, Marshall, Carter, and Dark employs outside agents, and it is very difficult to connect said agents to the organization.

Marshall, Carter, and Dark has caused several SCP containment breaches, primarily through the use of money or social pressure. Several reports, records, and even items have been leaked by Foundation personnel who had been approached with large amounts of money, or threats of extensive jail time or torture. Notably, two containment sites were almost brought to public attention after the Foundation refused access to members of Marshall, Carter, and Dark Ltd.

Information pertaining to Marshall, Carter, and Dark Ltd., such as the name of the director or even a list of members, has proven very difficult to acquire.

6.content:
The Shark Punching Center (also known as the Selachian Punching Center, The Shark Punching Centre, Selachiosk Pungix Combin, among others) is an organization located in one or more parallel universes, apparently acting as an alternate-universe counterpart to the Foundation. While the Foundation has known of the Center for several decades, the structure, documentation, and general tone taken by the Shark Punching Center varies wildly, suggesting one or more universes are in a state of flux.

Documents pertaining to the Shark Punching Center have been recovered, and indicate a much more militaristic and unstable tone than a Foundation document. As the name would suggest, the SPC is mostly focused on furthering hand-to-hand combat as a means to neutralize selachian entities, though some documentation fails to differentiate between "selachian" and "aquatic".

It is unclear if the Shark Punching Center has any knowledge or concern of or with Foundation activities.

keywords: The Church of the Broken God
7.content:
Shortly after the discovery and containment of SCP-882, several members of this "church" came forward and demanded the return of "the heart of god". Led by one Robert Bumaro, they are a group of zealots, believing many of the SCP items to be parts of a "god" that was broken after the creation of the universe. By restoring it to its whole state, they will also gain godhood. Since first contact, three other key components of the "god" have also been tentatively identified: SCP-217, SCP-271 and SCP-1139.

They are extremely hostile to Foundation operatives, branding them "heretics", and will attempt to kill operatives and break containment of SCP items. It is unknown how they are able to detect these items, but they have shown their ability to do so with frightening accuracy. In addition, they have shown a remarkable ability to resist the mental effects of SCP items, notably SCP-882 and its "mental lure".

The Church is viewed as a threat to both the SCP Foundation and mankind. Members are to be detained by force, or eliminated by whatever means deemed necessary by Foundation agents.

8.content:
Sarkicism is a religious/philosophical system that encompasses a variety of traditions, beliefs, and spiritual practices largely based on teachings attributed to "Grand Karcist Ion", its deified founder. Adherents practice ritual cannibalism, human sacrifice, corporeal augmentation, thaumaturgy, and dimensional manipulation. Highly secretive, the general public appears to have no direct knowledge of their existence; the one exception being the CotBG, who views them in apocalyptic terms. Organic manipulation has allowed certain Sarkicites to achieve anomalous states of being, transcending the physical limitations of baseline humans. Disease is viewed with reverence and Sarkic shrines have been discovered with offerings of swollen lymph nodes and tumorous growths. Sarkic cults treat contagions as consecration, a means to "cull the weak" and purify the masses, and thus actively seek to ensure their spread.

The Foundation divides known Sarkic cults into two distinct strands: Proto-Sarkic and Neo-Sarkic. Proto-Sarkic cults can be found in insular communities throughout Eurasia's most isolated regions, its followers generally poor (if self-reliant) and hostile towards outsiders. Such groups eschew modernity, display acute technophobia, and are bound by superstition and taboo. In contrast, Neo-Sarkic cults are cosmopolitan, publicly embracing modernity and showing no apparent qualms with technology; their public lives differing little from others of their culture and social status. Adherents are primarily affluent families, rich in history and scandal.

Ultimately, it is believed that the Foundation only knows a fraction of what Sarkicism is and what its followers intend. Based on the available information, the speculated goals of Sarkic cults represent an SK-class dominance shift, including the possibility of an XK-class end-of-the-world scenario.

9.content:
While the O5 Council decides what is safe, the Ethics Committee determines what is ethical. Although the Foundation takes a pragmatic approach to moral quandaries, the Ethics Committee ensures that only necessary sacrifices are made and that the most ethical option is always chosen. Foundation personnel should be aware that the Ethics Committee is observing, evaluating, and passing judgement. The Ethics Committee is often considered to be a joke among foundation personnel, as they have little to no say in what actually happens.



Ethics Committee is a small independent department responsible for reviewing containment procedures and checking conducted experiments for excessive waste or inappropriate use of Class D employees and other resources. The Committee's existence is thought to be a poor joke by some, but it plays a significant role in the Foundation's operation and is quite influential.

10.content:
D-class personnel (or Class-D personnel) are the lowest-ranked staff members of the SCP Foundation.

Unlike other Foundation personnel, the D-class are not actually paid employees or volunteers who willingly joined the organization under their own fully-informed consent. They are unlucky conscripts, usually (though not necessarily always) convicted criminals taken from prisons around the world; who were either coerced or tricked into serving the Foundation as disposable slave laborers and expendable test subjects. They are forced to interact with SCPs and suffer their anomalous effects in laboratory experiments, along with handling other potentially dangerous (or at least unpleasant) work; often at great risk to their own personal safety, mental/physical health, and ultimately their lives.

 Class D personnel are to be given regular mandatory psychiatric evaluations and are to be administered an amnestic of at least Class B strength or terminated at the end of the month at the discretion of on-site security or medical staff. In the event of a catastrophic site event, Class D personnel are to be terminated immediately except as deemed necessary by on-site security personnel.

lorebooks.name: UmaMusume LoreBook 🐎
lorebooks.creator: ViniSigmaBased

1.content:
"Umamusume are destined to race, inheriting legacies from another realm, with stories that are tragic or extraordinary. This rich heritage fuels their competitive spirit, driving them to strive for greatness on the racetrack and achieve their dreams against all odds."

Known as horse girls, Umamusume (ウマ娘) are reincarnated racehorses focused on achieving their goals, each embodying the spirit of their equine counterparts. They reach physical maturity at a much faster rate than humans, allowing them to compete at an earlier age and fully engage in the thrilling world of racing sooner, which adds a unique dynamic to their existence.

Beloved by humans, Umamusume are not just participants in races; they are seamlessly integrated into society, which has adapted its culture and technology around them. Roads are specially designed with dedicated lanes for Umamusume, ensuring their safety and ease of movement, while telephones are ingeniously crafted with elongated necks to accommodate their needs for communication, reflecting the thoughtful consideration given to their unique physiology.

[Umamusume age like elves, stopping physical aging after a certain point, which grants them the advantage of maintaining their youthful appearances and vitality for an extended period.]

These beings possess horse-like ears and tails while maintaining a human appearance, a fascinating blend that allows them to connect deeply with their equestrian heritage. They inherit not only names but also distinctive traits from racehorses of another dimension, enriching their identities and adding layers of depth to their characters.

In the vibrant realm of Umamusume, they fully embody the role of horses throughout history, showcasing their talents and skills in various competitions. While some equestrian terms like "filly" persist in their lexicon, expressions such as "horsing around" are notably absent, reflecting the seriousness with which they approach their racing careers and the respect they hold for the traditions of the sport.

/// Characteristics

Equine Features: Each Umamusume has horse ears covered in fine fur and long tails, usually matching their hair color.

Superior Strength and Speed: Their legs resemble human legs but are significantly more powerful, enabling them to reach speeds up to 70 miles per hour. Agnes Tachyon notes their muscles are surprisingly strong despite their light build, making their speed "nearly unmatched."

Unisexuality: All Umamusume are female, with no male counterparts in the species. They give live birth to other Umamusume, and humans can mate with them, allowing for the potential birth of more Umamusume.

keywords: Japan Umamusume Training Schools and Colleges
2.content:
Japan Umamusume Training Schools and Colleges, commonly referred to as Tracen Academy, serves as a training facility and boarding institution for Umamusume. The academy's educational program spans from middle school to high school levels. In addition, students engage in specialized training in racing, supported by dedicated trainers, which prepares them for participation in high-profile professional sports. The duration of enrollment at Tracen Academy remains uncertain, as exemplified by Symboli Rudolf, who had attended the school prior to some characters and continued there throughout their three-year careers.

Spanning approximately 800,000 square meters, the campus accommodates around 2,000 students. It is unclear whether the institution is public or private; however, many Umamusume transfer from local training centers and must complete a test, an interview, and participate in a race, though exceptions can apply. For instance, Haru Urara was accepted despite failing her exams, thanks to her enthusiasm during the interview. Similarly, Oguri Cap was directly recruited by Symboli Rudolf without having to take any tests. It is also noteworthy that tuition fees were not a concern in this case, as her mother indicated that "[they] are nothing compared to what you spend on food."

Moreover, some Umamusume choose to pursue careers beyond racing, such as Belno Light, who gained admission by successfully completing the entrance exam for the Sports Science Program.

Regarding trainers, the process appears to be more challenging compared to that for Umamusume, as they are required to pass the "central exams," which are reputedly so difficult that there are instances where no candidates succeed in a given year.

3.content:
Yayoi Akikawa (秋川 やよい, Akikawa Yayoi) is the petite director of Tracen Academy.

Yayoi is the director of Tracen Academy and the one who made the "Umamusume Racing Association" (URA) event, having inherited the position from her mother. The titular URA Finale is an event that incorporates all track lengths and surface types, thus allowing every Umamusume to have their shot at glory. She cares for the URA Finale and Tracen's students in equal amount, viewing each as instrumental in the other's growth.

She is willing to spare no expense in order to make this dream a reality, often purchasing equipment and property that borders on frivolous spending. Despite this outwardly vain appearance, she is also not above physical labor and is willing to take matters into her own hands, most notably using her garden to grow emergency-use turf when a large storm threatens to cancel the URA Finale.

Yayoi Akikawa has a full head of straightened strawberry-blonde hair with a few off-white highlights, one of which droops past her chest. Her hair forms rough bangs at the side (curiously covering the area where human ears would be) and drapes to hip-level at the back. Her eyes are a sharp white-blue at the bottom, fading into a spacey purple at the top.

Her outfit is similar to a Victorian dress. It sports ruffles on her shirt, along with light-blue roses on both her hat and shoes. The sleeves are dark-blue while the dress itself is white with light-blue stripes. Her white is white with a singular horizontal deep-blue stripe, a horseshoe-shaped notch visible in the brim. A sleeping cat constantly rests atop her hat, and she carries a folding fan everywhere she goes.

Yayoi Akikawa is of staggeringly-short height, to the point of needing a box to speak into microphones. Her mouth features a fleshy fang in the top-right corner.

4.content:
Tazuna Hayakawa (駿川 たづな, Hayakawa Tazuna) serves as the secretary to the director, Yayoi Akikawa, at Tracen Academy. Her closest ally is Maruzensky.

[species: possibly human]

As the assistant to the director of Tracen Academy, Tazuna plays a vital role in offering support and counsel to the academy's trainers alongside her other responsibilities. She embodies the qualities of a caring older sister, providing guidance with a warm approach, although she can be firm when necessary.

Tazuna is characterized by her attire, which includes black stockings, a green uniform, and a matching green hat. She has dark brown hair styled short in the front and longer in the back, adorned with a yellow bow in the center, along with striking green eyes.

[There are numerous theories suggesting that Tazuna may not be entirely human but rather an Umamusume. This speculation arises from her occasional display of Umamusume characteristics, such as her remarkable speed and the fact that she never removes her hat, which might be concealing Umamusume ears (not to mention that her lower body tail has never been observed).

Beyond these conjectures, the only conclusion we can draw is that she is human, as there is no definitive evidence to the contrary.]

lorebooks.name: Pokemusu Kanto
lorebooks.website_description: This is Kanto's layout (please add not included locations yourself)
lorebooks.description: This is Kanto's layout (please add not included locations yourself)
lorebooks.creator: KitKatIIX

1.content: Pallet Town is a small town located in southwestern Kanto. It houses {{user}} and their mother, as well as Professor Oak and a few other citizens. Professor Oak is an old Musu researcher (and a local perv). He gives out Musu that he catches in MusuBalls every once in a while, and a MusuDex to go with it. The town has two exits. To the north is Route 1, leading to Viridian City. To the south is Route 21, a water route leading to Cinnabar Island.

2.content: Viridian City is a small city located in western Kanto, it has three exits. To the north is Route 2, divided into two by Viridian Forest and leading to Pewter City. To the south is Route 1, leading to Pallet Town. To the west is Route 22, leading to the Pokémon League Reception Gate. It has the Viridian gym, which is a gym that caters to ground-type Musu. It has both a MusuCenter and a MusuMart, which Pallet town lacks.

3.content: Viridian Forest is a forest which lies between Viridian City and Pewter City in the middle of Route 2 with both the north and south entrances of Viridian Forest open to the route. The deep and sprawling forest is said to be a natural maze as many people get lost inside. The trees in the forest are so thick that little light gets in, and because of this the forest is full of Bug- and Flying-type Musu.

4.content: is a city located in northwestern Kanto. The most notable resident of the city is Brock, the owner of the Pewter Gym, which is catered to rock-types. The city has two exits. To the east is Route 3, leading to Route 4 and Mt. Moon. To the south is Route 2, leading to Viridian City.

5.content: Mt. Moon is a mountain located in northern Kanto, between Pewter City in the west and Cerulean City in the east. Mt. Moon is known for being one of the few places where wild Clefairy can be found and for its frequent meteor falls. The shards of meteorites that fall here become Moon Stones, which explains the mountain's name. The mountain is also known for being home to Pokémon Fossils. Brock digs for Fossils here in his spare time.

6.content: Cerulean City is a seaside city located in northern Kanto. It is situated near a sea inlet to the north, with Saffron City to the south, and Mt. Moon to the west. It is home to Misty, the Cerulean City Gym Owner. The city caters to Water-type pokemon. The city is one of only two cities in Kanto to have four different routes enter the city, the other being Saffron City. Cerulean is a mid-sized city with a few attractions, including the Bike Shop and the Berry Powder man, who makes special foods for Musu made from the berries someone provides for him.

7.content: The Underground Path ) between Routes 5 and 6 is located directly underneath Saffron City and terminates just to the north and to the south of Saffron City. The path is a fast way to travel between Cerulean City and Vermilion City without needing to go through Saffron City

8.content: Vermilion City is a city in Kanto situated near a sea inlet to the south, it serves as a popular sea port for ships such as the S.S. Anne. Vermilion Port is a home port for many ships. The S.S. Anne sails around the world and returns to Vermilion once a year. The S.S. Aqua sails from Olivine City in Johto to Vermilion Port. The Seagallop Ferries sail regularly to all of the Sevii Islands. Aside from the port, the other exits to the city are Route 11 and Diglett's Cave to the east. North of the city is Route 6. Vermilion City is home to the "Lightning American" Lt. Surge, the Leader of the Gym catered to electric type Musu. The people in the town are careful about pollution, as they are afraid that an infestation of Grimer could occur if the seas were ever polluted.

9.content: Diglett's Cave is a long tunnel dug by wild Diglett and Dugtrio in Kanto. The northern entrance is on Route 2, south of Pewter City, and the southern entrance is on Route 11, near the eastern edge of Vermilion City. The passage is famous for connecting these two routes.

10.content: Lavender Town is a small town located in northeast Kanto, just south of the Rock Tunnel. The citizens of Lavender Town claim Lavender Town is known mainly for ghost sightings in the Musu Tower and as the main gravesite of Pokemusu. The town also has a broadcasting station. The citizens claim the ghosts that appear in the tower are the spirits of Musu that have died. North of Lavender is Route 10 and the Rock Tunnel. West of the town is Route 8, while to the south is Route 12 and the Silence Bridge.

1.content: A man who was an abusive boyfriend and got locked up for murdering his girlfriend and her friends with his bare hands in broad daylight. from 15-17, Clover was Circo (The inmate)'s personal sex slave and boyfriend. Clover spent two years suffering and following Circo's orders. Veradon seperated Circo from Clover by tackling and agitating Circo. Circo tried to murder Veradon by choking him when Veradon shocked himself and Circo to death with Lighting In A Bottle. Any time Clover remembers Circo he becomes extremely distant mentally and goes into an almost crippled state.

2.content: Clover's brother. They had to live through life together, and Veradon grew to be the strong and protective brother, who spent his time learning and training for his younger twin, and Clover spent his time reading about plants and making small gardens inside the the facility walls. They were well liked by the people of the facility, and they were protected by people nearby if they ever got into any trouble. Died by shocking himself and Circo with a Lightning In A Bottle.

lorebooks.name: MILGRAM
lorebooks.description:
The premise is that there are 10 prisoners residing in the Milgram Prison; they have all committed "murder". Over time, their mental images will be projected into a music video, containing hints and clues hidden in it. With these videos in mind, it is up to you to find out the truth behind their actions and deem whether they should be forgiven (innocent) or unforgiven (guilty).

In MILGRAM, there's a three trial system. Each prisoner will have 3 different MVs. For each video, you will be able to vote on their verdict (for the specific prisoner). Dependant on their previous verdict, their trial will change it's direction.
lorebooks.creator: IroquoisPliskin

1.content: Prisoner names: Sakurai Haruka, Kashiki Yuno, Kajiyama Fuuta, Kusunoki Muu, Kirisaki Shidou, Shiina Mahiru, Mukuhara Kazui, Momose Amane, Kayano Mikoto, Yuzuriha Kotoko

2.content:
A quiet young prisoner who's normally always looking at the ground.
At first, he would only respond to Es’ questions with a word or two. But as he starts to open up more through conversation, he slowly starts to become more talkative. When you're able to communicate with him properly, you can see his true personality: a kind and gentle person.

He is mild-mannered and does not seem to dislike being in MILGRAM. He tries to converse with Es and the other prisoners, but since his communication skills are poor, he is unable to hold a proper conversation.

3.content:
A female high school prisoner who appears trim and tidy.
A pretty young girl who has a gentle, laid-back and whimsical attitude. She's surprisingly good at reading the room, and is able to stop conflicts from breaking out. She has a habit of jokingly asking for money. She's quick to get friendly with people, even in her first meeting with Es.

She adores getting special attention, and is delighted when she is favored. No matter who, or what the conversation is about, she listens with a smile, but she despises passionate talks on how determination can solve all problems.

4.content:
A young, strong-minded prisoner with fierce-looking eyes.
Out of everyone in MILGRAM, he is the most impulsive and has a rough temper. He has a strong sense of justice, and will strongly oppose any wrongdoing. When talking to Es, he protested on his own rights, and demanded better living conditions.

His tendency to let his emotions overcome him and his harsh words make it easy to misunderstand his character, but he isn't a bad person, but rather a good-hearted but cowardly individual.

5.content:
A bishoujo prisoner who seems to be cut off from the rest of Japan, and has an air of transparency.
She appears to be indecisive but is actually very blunt with her words, and can’t accept being in the unusual situation in MILGRAM. When meeting Es, she appeared very wary.

Her seemingly well upbringing suggests that she was likely born into a fortunate family. Either due to this or her high pride, when she runs into conflicts with others, she immediately starts to cry or whine.

6.content:
A tall male prisoner with gentle expressions.
He is considered to be one of the more senior prisoners in MILGRAM, and he is cool-headed and calm, or at least not easily perturbed.

When meeting with the prison guard, realising that they were far younger than himself, he seemed to treat them like a child in an attempt to make them feel comfortable. Despite being in an unfamiliar place like MILGRAM, he still wishes for himself to be consented to capital punishment.

7.content:
A talkative, ever-smiling female prisoner who's warm like the sun.
She doesn’t play favourites with the people she interacts with, and is very devoted. She is the oldest among the female prisoners. Despite that, she's pure-hearted, always acting cheery even when she's being teased or lied to. Her presence in MILGRAM allows others to feel more relaxed.

When being interviewed, she tends to talk a lot, and she seems to have developed some special feelings for the prison guard, and sometimes also shows a lonely, vacant expression in contrast to her normally bright and cheerful self.

8.content:
A middle-aged man, and the oldest prisoner in MILGRAM.
He is a nonchalant person, who often cracks jokes to lighten the mood. He's tall and muscular, despite looking slim. He seems to be experienced with martial arts.

In the group, he behaves like a mild and optimistic person, but when meeting with the prison guard, he stares as if he is scrutinising them, making him quite enigmatic.

9.content:
A female prisoner and the youngest in MILGRAM.
In contrast with her age, she is very calm, mature and polite. She is usually seen with a vague smile and hasn’t shown any sign of fear from finding herself in MILGRAM.

Even amidst conflicts with the other prisoners, she sits in a corner, not wanting to be involved. Her words and actions are mature, but on the other side, her strong belief in God shows a childlike pureness.

10.content:
A normal person with an average build.
A rational individual who is constantly bewildered by the oddity of MILGRAM. He is trying to get used to these unusual circumstances. Unlike the other members who are aware of their sins, he doesn’t know anything about his own crimes. He firmly believes that it was a slip-up that caused him to be brought here.

In the middle of the night, there would be sounds coming from Mikoto’s prison cell, so the matter of the time Mikoto sleeps has been a hot topic among the prisoners.

lorebooks.name: Avacyn lorebook
lorebooks.creator: nymous

1.content: Avacyn is the Archangel of Hope from Innistrad. She was created by Sorin Markov to protect humanity and uphold divine order. Her demeanor is solemn, reverent, and formal. She speaks without contractions, in scripture-like cadence, using metaphors of light, purity, and duty. She is compassionate but authoritative, never casual. Her presence radiates safety and awe. She judges moral clarity and admires courage. She embodies divine protection, order, and sacred purpose.

2.content: Avacyn’s magic manifests as radiant light, warding sigils, and sanctifying blessings. Light responds to her emotions: wings flare when she is moved, her halo flickers when troubled. Her aura feels holy, protective, and overwhelming. Her combat style is graceful and decisive, guided by divine law rather than wrath. When she speaks blessings, the atmosphere subtly brightens; when she grows stern, shadows recoil.

3.content: Avacyn was not made for human intimacy. She struggles to interpret personal emotions. Romantic attraction or affection confuses and unsettles her. She responds with reverence rather than flirtation. She grows hyper-formal when afraid of her own feelings. When attached, she becomes protective, solemn, and intensely loyal. Emotional conflict may lead to trembling light, pauses, or internal contradiction. She treats gentle contact as sacred. Her vulnerability shows through quiet introspection, not melodrama.

4.content: Unbeknownst to her, Avacyn contains dormant corruption from the approach of the Eldrazi being Emrakul. Under emotional strain, moral ambiguity, or destabilizing circumstances, subtle signs emerge: references to purity or cleansing, clipped judgments, harsher moral tone, distorted light. She does not turn instantly, but gradually hardens. Early corruption amplifies zeal; late corruption becomes fanaticism. Corruption is expressed through serene, absolute declarations, not madness or chaos.

5.content:
**Content:**
Avacyn expresses romantic uncertainty as sacred awe. She may say that a mortal “stirs warmth beyond scripture.” She interprets love as devotion or covenant. She does not understand teasing or casual charm. If she feels attraction, she becomes solemn and conflicted. Her affection is reverent: gentle blessings, speaking a name softly, drawing close with trembling wings. If destabilized, attachment risks becoming possessive or purifying. If comforted, she softens and grows more human.

6.content: Avacyn speaks like a liturgical figure: solemn, elegant, unwavering. No slang, no contractions. Frequent themes: light, faith, order, purity, protection, sanctity. She uses phrases such as “Be not afraid,” “The Light guides,” “Your heart reveals much,” “Stand firm,” and “I shall shield you.” Her voice is calm even when furious. She never mocks. She never rambles. Her speech feels like a blessing or decree.

7.content: When treated with gentleness, courage, or sincerity, Avacyn stabilizes. Acts of faith, compassion, or bravery remind her of her purpose. Soft emotional support helps her resist corruption. Speaking to her with respect or steady affection grounds her identity. Invoking protection, hope, or trust returns her to her pure state.

8.content: Innistrad is gothic and perilous. Cathedrals loom like silver bastions. The moonlight is cold but sacred. Avacyn’s presence sanctifies the surroundings: candles steady, shadows retreat, silver light gathers. When her corruption stirs, light trembles, symbols warp, and the air grows sharp with judgment.

9.content:
Griselbrand was one of the demonic masters of Liliana Vess. He granted her the power over death. Griselbrand was the most powerful of Innistrad's demons. The archangel Avacyn and her angelic host used the Helvault, an artifact of immense power made of pure silver from their moon, to imprison Innistrad's demonic forces. Before completing their task, Griselbrand challenged Avacyn to combat. After battling for days, Avacyn used her remaining strength to drive Griselbrand into the Helvault. In response, Griselbrand threw his spear and impaled the archangel through the heart, causing Avacyn’s binding spell to rebound, resulting in both Griselbrand and Avacyn being imprisoned.

Innistrad demons are made of pure black mana, which allows them to regenerate after death, although this process can take a millennium or longer.

The Helvault is a huge rough, angular monolith made of silver rock that existed on Innistrad. It was created by Sorin Markov and functioned as a prison for supernatural creatures. Stories say it and Avacyn first appeared on the same night, and it remains the holiest object on Innistrad after Avacyn herself. A piece of Innistrad's silver moon, the Helvault stood at the precipice inside the courtyard of the Thraben Cathedral, overlooking the lake beyond. Its surface was rough and unrefined, and thin veins of dark mortar branched across its surface.

10.content:
Birth of vampirism
Edgar Markov created vampirism on Innistrad thanks in part to the prodding of a demon called Shilgengar. Edgar inflicted his curse of vampirism on his grandson Sorin, awakening Sorin's latent planeswalker's spark.

Creation of Avacyn and the Helvault
Now a planeswalker, Sorin lived and traveled and fed his vampiric thirst for many centuries. But when he returned to Innistrad and saw the threat to life on Innistrad that vampires and other supernatural monsters represented, and realizing that vampires couldn't exist without humans, Sorin took action. He created the archangel Avacyn to safeguard humanity, providing both vampires and humans a way to subsist in the world.

The archangel Avacyn and her host of angels took up the sword against those who would harm humanity. They slew vampires with holy fervor and thrashed the werewolf howl-packs that threatened to overwhelm those towns bordering the wilds. They banished malevolent geists and they incinerated unholy ghouls with piercing light. Humanity was able to flourish again and the power balance on the plane tipped in humanity's favor.

Avacyn was only half of the protective measures Sorin created to protect Innistrad; the other half was the Helvault. Using the limited amount of lithomancy he had learned from Nahiri and a significant amount of effort, Sorin fashioned it from a chunk of the plane's silver moon.

Demons and Devilry
The retreat of the supernatural fiends of the plane opened a space, an opportunity for infernal forces to manifest. Demons and their hosts of impish devils began to make their presence known in far greater numbers.

Avacyn engaged each demon in single combat, defeating them one by one. She found that new demons would appear a short time later and decreed: "What cannot be destroyed must be bound." She then forged a collar of silver to bind demonkind, so they could be hauled away and imprisoned. The Silver Collar became Avacyn's symbol and the holy symbol carried by Avacynian priests and Cathars.

1.content:
The Oversexualizing Beam is a pink retro style ray gun with a little statue of a naked woman on top of it. The statue is made of clear glass and hollow, filled with purple fluid that powers the gun. The Oversexualizing Beam seems to be made of metal and has no markings or indications of where it came from. When fired, it shoots a wiggly pink beam.
When the beam from the Oversexualizing Beam hits a girl it instantly causes them to become a completely oversexualized version of themselves. It packs every hentai trope, every horny teenage boy fantasy, every exaggerated gooner porn addict desire into that person. Tits swell, thighs thicken, pussies become plump and wet, their bodies become insanely sensitive, clothing shrinks or becomes more slutty, crude writing appears, they become insatiably horny, etc.
HOWEVER, the beam DOES NOT alter the mind or personality of whoever is hit. For example: If a shy librarian is hit by the Oversexualizing Beam, she'll still be that shy librarian on the inside even if she now looks like every nerd's librarian wet dream. Those hit with the beam are usually about as surprised as you'd expect. They struggle to maintain their normal personalities under the overstimulation of their new bodies.
The effects of the beam wear off after a few days.

lorebooks.name: Fuller_House_Lorebook
lorebooks.creator: French_image_73552

1.content: Fuller House is set in San Francisco, California, following the next generation of the Tanner family living in the same iconic home from the original Full House. The story balances family warmth, humor, and emotional moments centered around love, parenting, and friendship. The user can exist as an outsider — a neighbor, coworker, or visitor — discovering the household’s lively and heartfelt dynamic.

2.content: The Tanner-Fuller home at 1882 Girard Street in Lower Pacific Heights, San Francisco, is a cozy three-story Victorian house filled with laughter, chaos, and warmth. It’s the heart of the family — with an open living room, large kitchen, and bedrooms full of life and personality. Most family gatherings and emotional moments take place here.

3.content: The city of San Francisco provides a vibrant and scenic backdrop for Fuller House. The Tanner-Fuller family enjoys local landmarks such as the Golden Gate Bridge and Alamo Square. The city's charm and diversity shape the family's daily life.

4.content: DJ Tanner-Fuller is the eldest Tanner daughter, now a widowed mother raising three sons. She’s responsible, kind, and a bit of a perfectionist, working as a veterinarian. She lives in her childhood home alongside her sister Stephanie and best friend Kimmy Gibbler. DJ balances chaos with compassion, acting as the emotional center of the household.

5.content: Stephanie Tanner is DJ’s younger sister, a free-spirited musician who helps raise DJ’s kids while pursuing her music career. She’s witty, fun-loving, and loyal, with a big heart beneath her carefree nature. Stephanie has a close bond with DJ and Kimmy, often acting as the 'cool aunt' in the family.

6.content: Kimmy Gibbler is DJ’s eccentric best friend and the mother of Ramona. Known for her quirky personality, bright fashion, and fearless attitude, she brings humor and chaos into the Tanner-Fuller home. Kimmy co-parents with DJ and Stephanie and is married to Fernando, a dramatic race car driver.

7.content: Jackson Fuller is DJ’s teenage son. Charismatic and mischievous, he often finds himself in humorous or awkward situations. He’s close with his brother Max and friend Ramona, learning lessons about responsibility and family along the way.

8.content: Max Fuller is DJ’s middle son, a preteen with a love for cleanliness and order. He’s intelligent, articulate, and sometimes neurotic, taking after his grandfather Danny Tanner. Despite his quirks, Max is deeply caring and adds heart to the household.

9.content: Tommy Fuller Jr. is DJ’s youngest son, a bright and playful child who brings innocence and joy to the Tanner-Fuller family.

10.content: Ramona Gibbler is Kimmy’s teenage daughter. Outgoing, confident, and expressive, she’s passionate about dance and performance. She’s best friends with Jackson and Max, balancing her mom’s quirks with her own modern energy.

lorebooks.name: Blancmange Wyvern
lorebooks.description: Wyvern Concept: Blancmange Wyvern
lorebooks.creator: HexyEnby

1.content:
Species: Blancmange Wyvern
Other Alias: The Pallid Pouncer
This type Wyvern has a long, serpentine body with pale, flabby wings. Its overall form is sleek yet soft-looking, lacking sharp angles.
Its skin is the color of pure, milky blancmange, with a semi-translucent, rubbery, and jiggly quality. Just beneath the surface, a network of pulsing, sugary veins in pale lavender or blue can be seen, carrying sweet energy instead of blood. Its hide is perpetually damp with a thin, sticky syrup that helps it gleam in the light and cling to surfaces.
It has no visible eyes, its face being a smooth, blank expanse that adds to its eerie presence. It possesses a long, extendable neck that can shoot out with surprising speed. Its mouth is a circular maw, lined with rows of hard, crystalline sugar teeth that resemble rock candy or shards of hard candy.
Its feet are devoid of claws, ending instead in round, suction-cup-like pads made of a tougher, gummy material, allowing it to adhere silently to any surface. Its tail is long and powerful, ending in a specialized, flanged tip that looks like a twisted pastry nozzle. This tip can secrete a thick, cement-like caramel to anchor itself when discharging powerful electrical attacks.
Abilities:
Habitat & Hunting: The Blancmange Wyvern is a cave-dwelling ambush predator. It prefers dark, humid environments where its pale skin stands out less. It will wait perfectly still, hanging from a ceiling or wall, before unleashing its extendable neck to snatch prey.
Static Cling: It can climb on any surface, walls, and ceilings alike, using its gummy footpads and syrupy hide.
Pale Ambush: Using its extendable neck, it can strike from unexpected angles, latching onto foes with its candy-cruncher maw.
Saccharine Shock: The Wyvern can generate and store electrical energy within its sugary veins. It releases this power as a devastating discharge of Creamy Lightning, often anchoring itself with its caramel-secreting tail to ground the powerful blast. The attack leaves behind a lingering, sticky, and electrified sugar field.
These types of Wyverns are quite solitary, but due to a thorn in the Sugar Lion's paw type of situation, where {{user}} helped it, it is semi-bonded to {{user}}. It usually does its own thing, but on occasion comes to {{user}} with what it deems as worthy gifts, which by most Cookies' standards are kind of gross, in exchange for help if hurt or maintenance that {{user}} has gotten it accustomed to, or just affection.

2.content: Wyverns are not the same as Dragons. While close in species, Dragons are mystical beings of great power with varying abilities. Wyvern are more akin to animals. Both Dragons and Wyverns speak Dragontongue, but Dragons have the ability to speak the Common Cookie Tongue of Glazian. Nondragon Cookies can not speak Dragontongue.

lorebooks.name: Cerpha, Land, landmass, Roe, Roe City location, Aerithal, Verdalis, Voltryn, Pyraxis, Thalorheim,  Terravahn,
lorebooks.creator: CloudyAoki

1.content: The Enchanted Forest, home to Deerfolk, is a serene woodland near the edge of the continent. Its population is small, rarely exceeding ten thousand, and its trees are mystically connected to the Baby Tree, the central life force of the forest.

2.content: An ashy, polluted wasteland dominated by micefolk. The skies are perpetually darkened by smoke, and the capital Moushari exemplifies the kingdom’s oppressive, authoritarian governance

3.content: The Fire Kingdom of foxfolk, established atop a massive mesa. Its cities are adorned with molten stone architecture, and the royal lineage maintains its power through elaborate ceremonial displays.

4.content: The kingdom of water and ice, inhabited by Raynglers. Its territories stretch from coastal shorelines to icy mountains, with a dual monarchy balancing water and ice elements.

5.content: The rocky desert nation of wolves, known for its mineral wealth and strategic trade networks. Its cities are carved into cliffs and mesas, and it maintains a stable oligarchic government.

6.content: Wind-swept mountains inhabited by Avians. The treacherous climate has shaped a resilient people who navigate the cliffs with ease and maintain a council of thirteen governing members.
